Cuando
el hombre ve con su corazón
Hungría
es el país que se extiende en el centro de Europa, y según muchos
aquí late el Chacra del Corazón de la Tierra. De aquél planeta que
brinda hogar a toda la humanidad, pero a pesar de eso unos quitan el
hogar, la comida, la vida, la familia de los otros. Nosotros, los
húngaros, sabemos como es cuando nos quitan nuestro hogar, y un día
despertamos como extraños en nuestra tierra natal.
Y
a pesar de eso somos nosotros los que erigimos reja de alambre ante
el rostro de las personas aterradas. Somos nosotros los que de la
Barraca más Alegre nos convertimos en la mancha de deshonra de
Europa. Fuimos nosotros los que oficializamos el odio y la exclusión.
¡No,
no fuimos nosotros! Nosotros no nos identificamos con los que le dan
una patada a los que yacen en el suelo. Nosotros somos los que vemos
con el corazón, y no miramos con el rabo del ojo al mundo a través
de nuestro miedo. Nosotros somos los que sienten, comprenden el
peligro y la trampa, el cual está en acecho sobre nosotros y sobre
Europa, y a pesar de eso podemos seguir siendo Personas.
Vemos
con nuestro corazón, y nuestra atención pasa sobre tales detalles,
como que cuanto mide exactamente el día de hoy la valla de alambre.
Por eso es, que recolectamos 275.000 dólares en vez de 175.000. La
Sabiduría Universal nos enseñó, que a que conlleva cuando el
hombre ve con el corazón y no con su ego. ""Por casualidad""
empezamos a recaudar más de lo que fue nuestra intención original.
Esto tiene fuerza. No lo vamos a deshacer, y no lo vamos a
rectificar. Porque nosotros vemos con el corazón: lo esencial.
Para
275.000 metros de alambre de espino es 275.000 dólares de amor

nuestra respuesta.


Wenn der Mensch mit seinem Herzen sieht

Ungarn ist jenes Land, welches in der Mitte Europas liegt und der Ort an dem vielen nach das Herzchakra unserer Erde schlägt. Das jenes Planeten, welcher das zu Hause aller Menschen ist, auf welchem dennoch der Eine das Zuhause, das Essen, das Leben oder gar die Familie des Anderen wegnimmt. Wir Ungarn wissen, was für ein Gefühl es ist, wenn man seiner Heimat beraubt wird und eines Tages als in unserer eigenen Heimat als Fremde aufwachen. 

Dennoch sind es gerade wir, die einen Stacheldrahtzaun vor den furchterflößten Gesichtern Anderer ziehen. Wir sind es, die aus der „muntersten Baracke“ zum Schandfleck Europas geworden sind. Wir sind diejenigen, welche Hass und Ausgrenzung für offiziell erklärt haben. 

Nein, das sind nicht wir, die so geworden sind! Wir sind nicht gleich jenen, welche die am Boden liegenden weiter treten. Wir sind jene, welche mit ihren Herzen sehen und nicht von hinter ihren Ängsten auf die Welt hinausschielen. Wir sind jene, die die Gefahr und Falle spüren und verstehen, welche auf uns und Europa lauert und dennoch menschlich bleiben können.

Wir sind jene, welche mit ihren Herzen sehen und deren Aufmerksamkeit vorübergleitet daran wie lang der Stacheldrahtzaun am heutigen Tage gerade ist. Deshalb konnte es passieren, dass wir 275.000 Dollar gesammelt haben, anstelle der geplanten 175.000. Die universelle Weisheit hat gezeigt, was passiert, wenn der Mensch mit seinem Herzen sieht, und nicht nur mit seinem Ego. „Ausversehen“ haben wir mehr Spenden gesammelt, als wir es geplant hatten. Dies bedeutet Kraft. Wir wollen das nicht rückgängig machen und nicht korrigieren. Denn wir sehen mit unseren Herzen: das Wesentliche. 

Auf die 275.000 Meter Stacheldrahtzaun heißt unsere Antwort 275.000 Dollar voller Liebe.



Quando la gente vede con il cuore

Ungheria é il paese, che si estende in mezzo dell’Europa, e tanti lo credono che qui pulsa il chakra di cuore (anahataciakra) della Terra. Di quella pianeta, che dá una patria a tutta la gente, eppure uno toglie la casa, il cibo, la famiglia dell’altro. Noi ungheresi lo sappiamo, come é quando qualcuno toglie la nostra casa, ed un giorno svegliamo come stranieri nella nostra terra di nascita.

Eppure siamo noi, che tiriamo un recinto di filo spinato davanti la faccia della gente terrorizzata. Siamo noi, che dalla „Baracca piú Allegra del Campo” siamo divenuti una macchia d’infama dell Europa. Siamo noi che avevamo ufficializzato l’odio e l’espulsione dei „differenti”.

Ma no, non siamo noi! Noi non siamo identici con quelli che vorrebbero dare un calcio alla persona che si estende sulla terra. Noi siamo quelli che vedono con il cuore, non guardiamo il mondo attraverso il velo della nostra paura. Noi siamo quelli, che sentono il puzzo del pericolo e delle trappole, che ci circondano – eppure siamo capaci a rimanere Umani.

Noi guardiamo con il cuore, e superiamo la domanda, quanti metri farebbe la lunghezza di quel recinto. Per questo é stato deciso di fare una colletta di 275 mila dollari invece di 175 mila.

La Somma Sapienza Universale ci ha fatto vedere, com’é quando uno vede con il suo cuore e non con il suo Ego. „Per sbaglio” abbiamo iniziato a raccogliere di piú della nostra idea iniziale. Peró questa ha una forza. Non ci ritiriamo, e non facciamo neanche la correzione. Perché con il cuore noi vediamo: la sostanza.

La nostra risposta ai 275 mila metri di fili spinati saranno 275 mila dollari di caritá.


Quand on voit avec le cœur

La Hongrie est un pays situé au centre de l’Europe, et beaucoup pensent que c’est ici que le Chakra du cœur de la Terre palpite, cette Terre qui accueille tous les Hommes
column2:
malgré cela, parfois un homme prend la  vie, la maison, la nourriture, la famille de l’autre. Nous les Hongrois, nous savons ce que signifie être privé de son habitation, de se réveiller un jour étranger dans sa propre patrie.

Et ce sont quand-même nous ceux qui posons des fils de fer barbelés devant le visage de personnes apeurées. Sur la carte de l’Europe nous sommes passés de « la plus heureuse caserne » à la tâche déshonorante. Nous sommes ceux qui ont officialisé la haine et l’exclusion.

Mais non ! Nous ne sommes pas ceux-là! Nous ne sommes pas comme ceux  qui donneraient un coup de pied à une personne couchée par terre. Nous sommes ceux qui voient avec le cœur et qui ne voient pas le monde uniquement à travers la peur. Nous sommes ceux qui sentent et comprennent le danger et la piège, auxquels nous sommes exposés, nous et l’Europe, mais sommes quand même capables rester Humains.  

Nous voyons avec le cœur, et les détails tels que la longueur actuelle des fils de fer barbelés ne retiennent pas notre attention. C’est pour cela que nous collectons 275.000 dollars au lieu des 175.000 prévus. La sagesse universelle a montré où conduit quand on voit avec son cœur et non pas avec son ego. « Par hasard » nous avons commencé à collecter plus d’argent que prévu. Ce hasard a du pouvoir. Nous ne retirons pas, ne rectifions pas le montant. Car nous voyons avec le cœur : c’est là l’essentiel.

Aux fils de fer barbelés d’une longueur de 275.000 mètres nous répondons par 275.000 dollars d’amour.


Когда человек видит сердцем

Венгрия - это страна, которая расположена в середине Европы, и где по мнению многих пульсирует Сердечная чакра Земли. То есть той Планеты, которая является общим домом для всех человечества, но всё равно одни люди отбирают у других жилище, еду, жизнь, семью. Мы, венгры, знаем, как это, когда нас лишают наших домов и наступает такой день, когда мы просыпаемся чужими на земле, на которой мы родились.

Но опять же, это мы - те, кто натягивает колючую проволоку перед лицами перепуганных до смерти людей. Это мы - те, кто из «Самого весёлого барака» Европы стали её стыдом. Мы стали теми, кто официально декларировал ненависть и непринятие.

Нет, такими стали не мы! Нас нельзя путать с теми, кто пинает ногой лежащих на земле. Мы те, кто видит сердцем, а не украдкой смотрит на мир, видя свои страхи. Мы те, кто чувствует и понимает опасности и ловушки, которые подстерегают нас и Европу, но всё равно смогли остаться Людьми.

Мы видим сердцем, и из нашего внимания выпадают такие детали как сколько метров составляет точная длина ограды из колючей проволоки на сегодняшний день. Поэтому получилось так, что мы стали собирать 275 000 долларов вместо 175 000. Всеобщая Мудрость показала, к чему приводит, когда человек видит сердцем, а не своим эго. «Случайно» получилось так, что мы начали собирать больше, чем первоначально намеревались. У этого есть сила. Мы не повернём это вспять и не будет исправлять. Потому что своими сердцами мы видим суть.

На 275 000 метров колючей проволоки наш ответ - 275 000 долларов любви

column1:
Az már mindegy, hogy HOGYAN adsz. Természetben vagy pénzben. Ahogy neked kényelmesebb.
Ha neked az kényelmesebb, hogy személyesen viszel ételt, italt, jó szót a menekülteknek, akkor tedd ezt.
Ha te erre nem érsz rá, akkor utalj pénzt. 
Mi nem csinálunk mást, mint összegyűjtjük és professzionális segítőket bízunk meg a feladattal.

Hide my name on the campaign page. Tedd ki a pipát. Az utalásod

egy újabb oldal, ahol megadhatod a kártyaadataidat ugyanúgy, mint

من الحب.* Para 275.000 metros de alambre de espino es 275.000 dólares de amor nuestra respuesta.*Auf die 275.000 Meter Stacheldrahtzaun heißt unsere Antwort 275.000 Dollar voller Liebe*La nostra risposta ai 275 mila metri di fili spinati saranno 275 mila dollari di caritá.*Aux fils de fer barbelés d’une longueur de 275.000 mètres nous répondons par 275.000 dollars d’amour.*На 275.000 метров колючей проволоки наш ответ - 275.000 долларов любви.*Amennyiben az elkövetkező egy hónapban Magyarországonaz aktív kereső korban lévők közülminden huszadik ember utal egyetlen dollárt,azaz kevesebb, mint 300 forintot, akkor jelen kampány célösszege össze fog gyűlni.
275.000 EMBERT keresünk,akinek elege lett az embertelenségből és hajlandó adni.Az összegyűlt pénzzel a Magyarországra menekült rászorulókon segítünk.
Amikor
szívével lát az ember
Magyarország
az az ország, amely Európa közepén fekszik és sokak szerint itt
lüktet a Föld Szívcsakrája. Azé a bolygóé, amely minden
embernek otthont ad, mégis egyik ember elveszi a másik otthonát,
ételét, életét, családját. Mi, magyarok, tudjuk, milyen az,
amikor elveszik otthonunkat és egy napon idegenként ébredünk
saját szülőföldünkön.
És
mégis mi vagyunk azok, akik drótkerítést húzunk rettegő emberek
arca elé. Mi vagyunk azok, akik a Legvidámabb Barakk-ból Európa
szégyenfoltja lettünk. Mi lettünk azok, akik hivatalossá tettük
a gyűlöletet és kirekesztést.
Nem,
nem mi lettünk azok! Mi nem vagyunk azonosak azokkal, akik
belerúgnának a földön fekvőkbe.
Mi azok vagyunk, akik a szívünkkel
látunk és nem a félelmeinken keresztül sandítunk a világra. Mi
vagyunk azok, akik érzik, értik a veszélyt és csapdát, ami ránk
és Európára leselkedik és mégis Emberek tudunk maradni.
A
szívünkkel látunk és az olyan részletek felett elsiklik a
figyelmünk, hogy az a szögesdrót kerítés pontosan hány méter a
mai napon. Ezért
lett az, hogy 275.000 dollárt gyűjtünk 175.000 helyett. Az
Egyetemes Bölcsesség megmutatta, mire vezet az, amikor az ember a
szívével lát és nem az egójával. ""Véletlenül""
többet kezdtünk gyűjteni, mint amennyi az eredeti szándékunk
volt. Ennek ereje van. Nem csináljuk vissza

és nem javítjuk ki. Mert mi a szívünkkel látjuk: a lényeget.When you see with your heartHungary is a country in the center of Europe, and many say it is the place where throbs the Earth's Heart Chakra. That of the planet which gives home to all human beings, and yet, people take each other's homes, food, lives or families. We, Hungarians, know what it is like, when our homes are taken from us and when out of the blue we wake up as strangers in our own motherland.And still, we are the ones pulling barbwire fences in front of the faces of terrified people. We are the ones, who turned from being the Happiest Barrack to Europe's disgrace. We became the ones who made hate and exclusion official. No, we didn't! We are not of one mind with those who would kick someone already down. We are the ones, who can see with their hearts, and are not peering out at the world through the lense of our fears. We are the ones, who feel and understand the danger and the trap that looms over us and over Europe, and yet we are able to remain Human.We see with our hearts, and our eyes skip over details like how many meters wide the barbwire fence is exactly on this day. That is why we are collecting 275,000 dollars instead of 175,000. Universal Wisdom shows us the way, when people see with their hearts, instead of their egos. We ""accidentally"" started collecting more than was our original intent. That is powerful. We will not undo it and we will not rectify it. Because we see with our hearts: we see what matters.Our answer to 275,000 meters of barbwire is 275,000 dollars of love.

من الحب.
Cuando
el hombre ve con su corazón
Hungría
es el país que se extiende en el centro de Europa, y según muchos
aquí late el Chacra del Corazón de la Tierra. De aquél planeta que
brinda hogar a toda la humanidad, pero a pesar de eso unos quitan el
hogar, la comida, la vida, la familia de los otros. Nosotros, los
húngaros, sabemos como es cuando nos quitan nuestro hogar, y un día
despertamos como extraños en nuestra tierra natal.
Y
a pesar de eso somos nosotros los que erigimos reja de alambre ante
el rostro de las personas aterradas. Somos nosotros los que de la
Barraca más Alegre nos convertimos en la mancha de deshonra de
Europa. Fuimos nosotros los que oficializamos el odio y la exclusión.
¡No,
no fuimos nosotros! Nosotros no nos identificamos con los que le dan
una patada a los que yacen en el suelo. Nosotros somos los que vemos
con el corazón, y no miramos con el rabo del ojo al mundo a través
de nuestro miedo. Nosotros somos los que sienten, comprenden el
peligro y la trampa, el cual está en acecho sobre nosotros y sobre
Europa, y a pesar de eso podemos seguir siendo Personas.
Vemos
con nuestro corazón, y nuestra atención pasa sobre tales detalles,
como que cuanto mide exactamente el día de hoy la valla de alambre.
Por eso es, que recolectamos 275.000 dólares en vez de 175.000. La
Sabiduría Universal nos enseñó, que a que conlleva cuando el
hombre ve con el corazón y no con su ego. ""Por casualidad""
empezamos a recaudar más de lo que fue nuestra intención original.
Esto tiene fuerza. No lo vamos a deshacer, y no lo vamos a
rectificar. Porque nosotros vemos con el corazón: lo esencial.
Para
275.000 metros de alambre de espino es 275.000 dólares de amor

nuestra respuesta.Wenn der Mensch mit seinem Herzen siehtUngarn ist jenes Land, welches in der Mitte Europas liegt und der Ort an dem vielen nach das Herzchakra unserer Erde schlägt. Das jenes Planeten, welcher das zu Hause aller Menschen ist, auf welchem dennoch der Eine das Zuhause, das Essen, das Leben oder gar die Familie des Anderen wegnimmt. Wir Ungarn wissen, was für ein Gefühl es ist, wenn man seiner Heimat beraubt wird und eines Tages als in unserer eigenen Heimat als Fremde aufwachen. Dennoch sind es gerade wir, die einen Stacheldrahtzaun vor den furchterflößten Gesichtern Anderer ziehen. Wir sind es, die aus der „muntersten Baracke“ zum Schandfleck Europas geworden sind. Wir sind diejenigen, welche Hass und Ausgrenzung für offiziell erklärt haben. Nein, das sind nicht wir, die so geworden sind! Wir sind nicht gleich jenen, welche die am Boden liegenden weiter treten. Wir sind jene, welche mit ihren Herzen sehen und nicht von hinter ihren Ängsten auf die Welt hinausschielen. Wir sind jene, die die Gefahr und Falle spüren und verstehen, welche auf uns und Europa lauert und dennoch menschlich bleiben können.Wir sind jene, welche mit ihren Herzen sehen und deren Aufmerksamkeit vorübergleitet daran wie lang der Stacheldrahtzaun am heutigen Tage gerade ist. Deshalb konnte es passieren, dass wir 275.000 Dollar gesammelt haben, anstelle der geplanten 175.000. Die universelle Weisheit hat gezeigt, was passiert, wenn der Mensch mit seinem Herzen sieht, und nicht nur mit seinem Ego. „Ausversehen“ haben wir mehr Spenden gesammelt, als wir es geplant hatten. Dies bedeutet Kraft. Wir wollen das nicht rückgängig machen und nicht korrigieren. Denn wir sehen mit unseren Herzen: das Wesentliche. Auf die 275.000 Meter Stacheldrahtzaun heißt unsere Antwort 275.000 Dollar voller Liebe.Quando la gente vede con il cuoreUngheria é il paese, che si estende in mezzo dell’Europa, e tanti lo credono che qui pulsa il chakra di cuore (anahataciakra) della Terra. Di quella pianeta, che dá una patria a tutta la gente, eppure uno toglie la casa, il cibo, la famiglia dell’altro. Noi ungheresi lo sappiamo, come é quando qualcuno toglie la nostra casa, ed un giorno svegliamo come stranieri nella nostra terra di nascita.Eppure siamo noi, che tiriamo un recinto di filo spinato davanti la faccia della gente terrorizzata. Siamo noi, che dalla „Baracca piú Allegra del Campo” siamo divenuti una macchia d’infama dell Europa. Siamo noi che avevamo ufficializzato l’odio e l’espulsione dei „differenti”.Ma no, non siamo noi! Noi non siamo identici con quelli che vorrebbero dare un calcio alla persona che si estende sulla terra. Noi siamo quelli che vedono con il cuore, non guardiamo il mondo attraverso il velo della nostra paura. Noi siamo quelli, che sentono il puzzo del pericolo e delle trappole, che ci circondano – eppure siamo capaci a rimanere Umani.Noi guardiamo con il cuore, e superiamo la domanda, quanti metri farebbe la lunghezza di quel recinto. Per questo é stato deciso di fare una colletta di 275 mila dollari invece di 175 mila.La Somma Sapienza Universale ci ha fatto vedere, com’é quando uno vede con il suo cuore e non con il suo Ego. „Per sbaglio” abbiamo iniziato a raccogliere di piú della nostra idea iniziale. Peró questa ha una forza. Non ci ritiriamo, e non facciamo neanche la correzione. Perché con il cuore noi vediamo: la sostanza.La nostra risposta ai 275 mila metri di fili spinati saranno 275 mila dollari di caritá.Quand on voit avec le cœurLa Hongrie est un pays situé au centre de l’Europe, et beaucoup pensent que c’est ici que le Chakra du cœur de la Terre palpite, cette Terre qui accueille tous les Hommes
column2: malgré cela, parfois un homme prend la  vie, la maison, la nourriture, la famille de l’autre. Nous les Hongrois, nous savons ce que signifie être privé de son habitation, de se réveiller un jour étranger dans sa propre patrie.Et ce sont quand-même nous ceux qui posons des fils de fer barbelés devant le visage de personnes apeurées. Sur la carte de l’Europe nous sommes passés de « la plus heureuse caserne » à la tâche déshonorante. Nous sommes ceux qui ont officialisé la haine et l’exclusion.Mais non ! Nous ne sommes pas ceux-là! Nous ne sommes pas comme ceux  qui donneraient un coup de pied à une personne couchée par terre. Nous sommes ceux qui voient avec le cœur et qui ne voient pas le monde uniquement à travers la peur. Nous sommes ceux qui sentent et comprennent le danger et la piège, auxquels nous sommes exposés, nous et l’Europe, mais sommes quand même capables rester Humains.  Nous voyons avec le cœur, et les détails tels que la longueur actuelle des fils de fer barbelés ne retiennent pas notre attention. C’est pour cela que nous collectons 275.000 dollars au lieu des 175.000 prévus. La sagesse universelle a montré où conduit quand on voit avec son cœur et non pas avec son ego. « Par hasard » nous avons commencé à collecter plus d’argent que prévu. Ce hasard a du pouvoir. Nous ne retirons pas, ne rectifions pas le montant. Car nous voyons avec le cœur : c’est là l’essentiel.Aux fils de fer barbelés d’une longueur de 275.000 mètres nous répondons par 275.000 dollars d’amour.Когда человек видит сердцемВенгрия - это страна, которая расположена в середине Европы, и где по мнению многих пульсирует Сердечная чакра Земли. То есть той Планеты, которая является общим домом для всех человечества, но всё равно одни люди отбирают у других жилище, еду, жизнь, семью. Мы, венгры, знаем, как это, когда нас лишают наших домов и наступает такой день, когда мы просыпаемся чужими на земле, на которой мы родились.Но опять же, это мы - те, кто натягивает колючую проволоку перед лицами перепуганных до смерти людей. Это мы - те, кто из «Самого весёлого барака» Европы стали её стыдом. Мы стали теми, кто официально декларировал ненависть и непринятие.Нет, такими стали не мы! Нас нельзя путать с теми, кто пинает ногой лежащих на земле. Мы те, кто видит сердцем, а не украдкой смотрит на мир, видя свои страхи. Мы те, кто чувствует и понимает опасности и ловушки, которые подстерегают нас и Европу, но всё равно смогли остаться Людьми.Мы видим сердцем, и из нашего внимания выпадают такие детали как сколько метров составляет точная длина ограды из колючей проволоки на сегодняшний день. Поэтому получилось так, что мы стали собирать 275 000 долларов вместо 175 000. Всеобщая Мудрость показала, к чему приводит, когда человек видит сердцем, а не своим эго. «Случайно» получилось так, что мы начали собирать больше, чем первоначально намеревались. У этого есть сила. Мы не повернём это вспять и не будет исправлять. Потому что своими сердцами мы видим суть.На 275 000 метров колючей проволоки наш ответ - 275 000 долларов любви

Plot Summary

John Moore has championed Colorado theatre for 15 years as a dedicated arts journalist. He founded the Denver Actors Fund and has raised more than $100,000 to help local artists in need. Now he has written a topical, full-length play called ""Waiting for Obama"" that has been selected from among 1,200 entries to be featured at the 20th annual New York Fringe Festival in August 2016. But first, it will be presented at the Buntport Theater in Denver and at the Bas Bleu Theatre in Fort Collins so local audiences can see it on its way to New York. Let's help John put your money where his mouth has been since 2001. Your donation will help:

  • Build an all-Colorado production that will be showcased with five performances in New York City.

• Provide gainful employment for seven Colorado actors, a stage manager and director.
  • Showcase the talents of Colorado artists at one of the most prestigious theatre festivals in America. This is something we can all take ownership and pride in.
So what is this play about?
<ul>
• In ""Waiting for Obama,"" one Colorado family is convinced the President is coming for their guns. And they're right.

• While propelled by one of the most divisive issues of our time, ""Waiting for Obama"" is the story of a recognizable family that, like many others, is trying to stick together while deeply divided by polarizing political beliefs.

• The director of ""Waiting for Obama"" is  Brian Freeland, who carried the torch for avant garde theatre in Denver for 20 years with his LIDA Project Theatre. The all-star, all-local cast will be announced soon. John and Brian are presenting the play under the name Wild Blindness Productions.
Making art isn't as easy as it sounds

• Making theatre is expensive. Making it from scratch is insane. Making it from scratch and then taking it to the most expensive city in America is downright daunting. Some of the major expenses include venue rental, airfare, lodging, technical support and FAIRLY COMPENSATING ARTISTS FOR THEIR WORK! 
  • Many crowdfunding campaigns offer clever incentives. We've thought of a few, including the opportunity to see the play in Denver before anyone in New York. But let's face it: This is about helping to make art locally, and presenting it nationally. Helping to make that happen is the greatest perk we have to offer.

• Please consider donating at any level. We are also seeking individual actor sponsors at $3,000 each. If you have the means and the interest, please consider sponsoring a Colorado actor of your choice. For further information, email culturewestjohn@gmail.com
• All donations that require tax receipts should be mailed directly to Bas Bleu Theatre Company, 401 Pine St., Fort Collins, CO 80524, with WILD BLINDNESS written in the topic field.

Risks and challenges

Making theatre is inherently risky. For years, John Moore supported the creation of new work for the American theatre. This is your chance to help make it happen properly - without the creators risking financial oblivion.

    Other ways you can help

    If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please help us get the word out, and make some noise about ""Waiting for Obama."" Encourage your friends to attend one of our workshop performances at the Buntport Theater in Denver from July 28-Aug. 7, or at Bas Bleu Theatre in Fort Collins on Monday. Aug. 1.

Making theatre is expensive. Making it from scratch is insane. Making it from scratch and then taking it to the most expensive city in America is downright daunting. Some of the major expenses include venue rental, airfare, lodging, technical support and FAIRLY COMPENSATING ARTISTS FOR THEIR WORK!   Many crowdfunding campaigns offer clever incentives. We've thought of a few, including the opportunity to see the play in Denver before anyone in New York. But let's face it: This is about helping to make art locally, and presenting it nationally. Helping to make that happen is the greatest perk we have to offer.

Please consider donating at any level. We are also seeking individual actor sponsors at $3,000 each. If you have the means and the interest, please consider sponsoring a Colorado actor of your choice. For further information, email culturewestjohn@gmail.com
All donations that require tax receipts should be mailed directly to Bas Bleu Theatre Company, 401 Pine St., Fort Collins, CO 80524, with WILD BLINDNESS written in the topic field.

Risks and challenges  Making theatre is inherently risky. For years, John Moore supported the creation of new work for the American theatre. This is your chance to help make it happen properly - without the creators risking financial oblivion.     Other ways you can help If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:  Please help us get the word out, and make some noise about ""Waiting for Obama."" Encourage your friends to attend one of our workshop performances at the Buntport Theater in Denver from July 28-Aug. 7, or at Bas Bleu Theatre in Fort Collins on Monday. Aug. 1.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Denver, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/wait-john-moore-got-into-the-new-york-fringe--2/pica

ONDADURTO TEATRO will go to produce a new production in 2016.
column2: >But we need you and your support to give life to a new dream, a new vision, a new passion! To give life to the new show
column4:
>CAFE EUROPA.

A group of 25 people is working on the production: actors and actresses, organization and creative staff, costumes and machineries departments, video and audio technicians, smiths and all the people supporting us.

Nowadays Culture and Art great difficulties for surviving.                  PLEASE, SUPPORT OUR CAMPAIGN or SHARE IT ON SOCIAL NETWORKS.

PLOT OF THE SHOW:

Humans migrate by their nature, always. People flow, mingle, rebuild their-selves. 

How can we not consider that we are all migrants? We will always be foreign to someone, sometimes we are strangers even for ourselves, drained away of humanity by a society that locks its doors, raises barriers, tears apart, poisoning us by fear.

Our story talks about the small village rising around CAFE EUROPA.

CAFE EUROPA is surrounded by mountains, not too far from sea: from here, we can admire its jagged coast and feel its smell. Up here, where the road takes visitors to an old Cafe, in a strange Hotel, in the hearth of the village. 

The old road, the Cafe, the radio, the hotel, the preparations for the 1.000 Miles Race (the most awaited event for the village).

Allegory of a modern society, a grotesque tale, an attentive game of echoes between reality and poetry, between dream and cruelty of workaday life. An ironic glance that gives to the audience an interesting perspective about nowadays, taking enormous delight in mocking and mirroring man’s hypocrisy and vices with an eye on the spectator, both complicit and accusatory.


And What about us?

ONDADURTO TEATRO is a theatre company founded in 2005, based in Rome. 

It’ s leaded by Marco Paciotti e Lorenzo Pasquali and grown thanks to the joined work of whom has been involved in the activities throughout the years.

The research and the artwork of ONDADURTO TEATRO are focused on Physical Theatre, Nouveau Cirque and Gesture. Different techniques of expression create a strong visual language able to interact with people of any age, ethnicity and culture and to reach an international audience.

Its performances and shows combine the use of Big Objects in movement, Machineries, Fireworks, Water games, Video projections and Music.

www.ondadurtoteatro.it

///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


ONDADURTO TEATRO produrrà un nuovo spettacolo nel 2016.

Ma ABBIAMO BISOGNO DI VOI  e del vostro sostegno per dare vita ad un nuovo sogno, una nuova visione, una nuova passione! Per dare vita al nuovo  spettacolo: CAFE EUROPA

Un gruppo di 25 persone sta lavorando alla produzione tra attori e attrici, organizzazione e staff creativo, reparto costumi, creazione macchinari, tecnici audio e video, fabbri e tutte le persone che ci sostengono e lavorano al progetto.

La cultura e l'arte in questo momento hanno difficoltà a sopravvivere. SUPPORTA LA NOSTRA PRODUZIONE O CONDIVIDILA SUI SOCIAL MEDIA.

TRAMA DELLO SPETTACOLO:

column1: L’essere umano migra per natura,
da sempre. I popoli viaggiano, si mischiano, si ricompongono. Come non si può
non considerare che siamo tutti migranti? <b>Saremo
sempre estranei per qualcuno, talvolta siamo estranei anche per noi stessi,
privati dell’ umanità e dell’ accoglienza da una società che chiude le porte,
alza le barriere, divide, <b>avvelenandoci
di paura.
Questa è la storia della cittadina
che sorge attorno a CAFE EUROPA.
CAFE EUROPA è situato
fra le montagne, non troppo lontano dal mare, di cui, da questa altezza, se ne
ammirano le coste frastagliate. Quassù, dove la strada si conclude all’ingresso
di un vecchio Cafe, attorno al quale si erge il villaggio.
La strada, il caffè, la radio,
l’hotel, i preparativi per il passaggio della Mille Miglia
Allegoria di una società moderna, un racconto grottesco, un gioco attento
di echi tra realtà e poesia, tra il sogno e la crudeltà della vita di tutti i
giorni.
Uno sguardo ironico che dà al pubblico
una <b>prospettiva interessante dei giorni
d'oggi, che con enorme piacere sbeffeggia

i vizi dell'uomo con un occhio ironico e accusatorio.


Vuoi sapere qualcosa su di noi?

ONDADURTO TEATRO  è una compagnia di teatro nata nel 2005, con sede a Roma. 

E' guidata da Marco Paciotti e da Lorenzo Pasquali ed è cresciuta grazie ad un lavoro congiunto con chi negli anni ha partecipato ai progetti della compagnia. 

La ricerca e il lavoro di ONDADURTO TEATRO sono da sempre incentrati sul Physical Theatre, il Nouveau Cirque ed il Gesto. Le diverse tecniche e modalità espressive danno vita a un linguaggio visivo di forte impatto, in grado di dialogare con persone di ogni età, etnia e cultura e di raggiungere un pubblico internazionale. 

I suoi spettacoli prevedono l’uso combinato di macchinari, grandi oggetti in movimento, fuochi d’artificio, giochi d’acqua, musica e proiezioni video.

www.ondadurtoteatro.it

William S. Burroughs has been a literary and cultural hero of
mine for 26 years. In 2010, I wrote an award winning one-man show called The
Burroughs and Kookie Show: Late Night in the Interzone. It was a wild adventure
into the absurd, surreal, and post modern world of Burroughs. During the 60
minute one-act play I was able to reveal the spirit and energy of my hero while
at the same time reveal some deeply painful and revelatory personal truths of
my own.
Now, in 2015, I have decided to challenge myself to take my Burroughsian
journey to the next level. Over the next year I plan to travel to Europe,
Morocco, Mexico, South America, and throughout the US to literally walk in
William S. Burroughs footsteps. This August, I shall visit every city in Europe
that Burroughs lived in, ending my visit in Tangier, Morroco where he wrote his
most celebrated novel, Naked Lunch.
Later, this year I shall travel to Mexico City to visit the location where Bill
accidentally shot and killed his wife, Joan Vollmer. Thus, catalyzing what
would become a lifetime of writing dedicated to ridding himself of what he
termed ""the Ugly Spirit"" that he firmly believed possessed and forced
him to commit his tragic mistake.
Next January, I shall again visit New York City, Chicago, New Orleans, St.
Louis, and Lawrence, KS - to see his American stomping grounds.
While traveling I will be working on a new two-act rock opera called, BURROUGHS 101: The Cold Dead Truth.
This rock opera will dig deep into the life and times of William S. Burroughs,
deeper than ever before. I plan to reveal many unknown truths that very few
people know or remember about this iconic literary hero. He was so much more
than a junky, a wife killer, and literary revolutionary, and the Godfather of
Punk. He, like all of us, was a person with the same need for love and respect,
and with the same weaknesses that can lead a person away from their true path.
Your support during this 4 part campaign will help, during the 1st stage, pay for air travel, train travel, rental cars, hotels, motels,
coffees, cocktails, meals, and pens and paper-pens and paper-pens and papers
throughout my travels to Europe and Tangier. The 2nd stage, I shall travel and research
Mexico City and South America to unlock secrets regarding the accidental killing
of his wife, Joan Volmer, and his adventures in search of a cure to purge him
of the Ugly Spirt he believed possessed his body and drove him to commit the
tragic event – that would forever haunt him and his writing. The 3rd stage
will focus on my journey through the US to visit St. Louis – his birth place,
New York City – where he first met Allen Ginsberg and Jack Keruoac at Columbia
University, Chicago – where he worked as an exterminator,  New Orleans – where
he lived with his wife Joan, and then Rio Grande South Texas where he and
Joan lived with their two children and grew marijuana under the umbrella of

purporting to be corn farmers.  

Throughout my travels I shall post daily video reports as William S. Burroughs. Some special funders will have the reports delivered to them personally!
Ultimately, upon my return to San Francisco – I shall begin the

4th and final stage of the campaign to raise funds to produce BURROUGHS 101: The Cold Dead Truth in the Summer of 2016.  I will need funds to pay actors, designers, and rent the venue that will house this grand rock opera multimedia spectacular.
It is my ardent hope, that you will help fund this campaign to
help me make my dream a reality, so that I may share the fruits of my labors
with you, onstage, when I return from my Burroughsian walk about.

VALLETO's
Artistic Director, Valeria Yvette Gonzalez, found herself while
exploring her passion for movement  and the unconscious mind. As a
result this and her constant desire to make a difference in the world of
dance, VALLETO was conceived in 2014. Many of her personal experiences
and cultural encounters in the artistic world led her to create VALLETO
as a dance company that also advocates for equality. As a Mexican dance
artist, her vision is to raise a stronger voice for dance and the arts

in countries where dance is not empowered the way it should be.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

VALLETO is now a platform that innovates dance, unifies the arts and advocates for equality.

2016
company dancers: Suzuka Matsumoto, Gabriela Rendon, Valeria Y.
Gonzalez, Laura Bowers and Allison Metts. (Photo Credit: Melissa

Gamache)

VALLETO’s is a contemporary dance theater
company with roots of Gaga, Hip-hop and Ballet techniques. The performances
explore what the unconscious mind hides in the body. The process becomes a
playground for senses, imagination, stories and emotions explored through a <i>magnified
glass.
VALLETO also narrates different topics in an abstract or humorous way to
reveal the relationship between body, the objective reality and the

unconscious mind in this new digital era.

Our MISSION is
to create performances, initiatives, dance workshops and events
that leave a transformative experience. Our VISION is to inspire, impact, and
empower the artistic community all around the globe, and to create initiatives

that empower the global unheard voices in the current millennium.

(""#VOIDS"" May 9th, 2015 at CPR / Photo Credit: Luis Nieto Dickens)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Why an INDIEGOGO Campaign?

VALLETO made its first company debut thanks to the amazing supporters who
believed in us and donated through a crowdfunding platform back in
2014. Thankfully, their support was able to take us even further than
promised and we have accomplished so much!
<li>We premiered our first
season “Inner Dialogues” at The Kraine Theater in the East
Village with a FULL HOUSE.
• We created 5 dance workshops with guest dance artists.
• We performed in Washington Square Park.
• We hosted a screening event for french artist JR called ""ELLIS"" and opened up a public conversation about Immigration.
<li>We created and performed our second season called
“#VOIDS” at the acclaimed theater ""Center for Performance Research"" in Brooklyn.
• We developed an improvisation, ballet and contemporary workshop in Cd. Juarez, Mexico.
• We introduced Gaga Technique in a workshop in Mexico.
• We were selected to be part of the “Sublet Series” at HERE Arts in
SOHO where “Lesson Unlearned” made its debut successfully at the Dorothy B.
Williams Theater.
<li>We have created free events including our “Equality
First” conversations where the public is invited.

WANT TO SEE IT WITH YOUR OWN EYES?

BELOW is a recapitulation:

Español
: Luis Nieto Dickens
Valeria Yvette
González, Directora Artística de VALLETO, se encontró a sí misma cuando
descubrió su pasión por crear movimiento, la mente inconsciente y su gran deseo
de marcar una diferencia en el mundo de la danza, y como resultado fundó
VALLETO en 2014. Muchas de sus experiencias, y encuentros culturales en el
mundo artístico la llevo a crear VALLETO, una compañía de danza contemporánea
que también apoya y promueve la diversidad cultural en el mundo de la danza y
los derechos de igualdad en el mundo. Como bailarina mexicana, su visión es
empoderar la danza contemporánea y poder darle una voz fuerte al arte en países
donde el arte es visto como un “hobby.”
Fotografía:Melissa Gamache
VALLETO es una compañía de danza contemporánea que emplea raíces de técnicas
como Gaga, Hip-hop y Ballet. Nuestros espectáculos representan emociones e
historias creadas desde una exploración profunda de lo que la mente
inconsciente esconde en el cuerpo. Durante el proceso de crear cada coreografía
exploramos, jugamos y observamos intensamente nuestra imaginación, nuestros
sentidos, nuestras historias y sobre todo emociones.
Fotografía: Melissa Gamache
<div>
VALLETO
también narra diferentes temas de forma abstracta o cómica, para así mismo
transmitir de diferentes formas la relación que hay entre un cuerpo, una
realidad objetiva y la mente inconsciente en esta nueva era digital.

crear espectáculos, iniciativas de empoderamiento, cursos de danza y eventos

crear iniciativas donde apoyemos globalmente a voces que aún son ignoradas en
este milenio.

<div>
","VALLETO's
Artistic Director, Valeria Yvette Gonzalez, found herself while
exploring her passion for movement  and the unconscious mind. As a
result this and her constant desire to make a difference in the world of
dance, VALLETO was conceived in 2014. Many of her personal experiences
and cultural encounters in the artistic world led her to create VALLETO
as a dance company that also advocates for equality. As a Mexican dance
artist, her vision is to raise a stronger voice for dance and the arts

in countries where dance is not empowered the way it should be.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------VALLETO is now a platform that innovates dance, unifies the arts and advocates for equality.2016
company dancers: Suzuka Matsumoto, Gabriela Rendon, Valeria Y.
Gonzalez, Laura Bowers and Allison Metts. (Photo Credit: Melissa
Gamache)VALLETO’s is a contemporary dance theater
company with roots of Gaga, Hip-hop and Ballet techniques. The performances
explore what the unconscious mind hides in the body. The process becomes a
playground for senses, imagination, stories and emotions explored through a magnified
glass.
Photo by: Luis Nieto Dickens
VALLETO also narrates different topics in an abstract or humorous way to
reveal the relationship between body, the objective reality and the
unconscious mind in this new digital era.Our MISSION is
to create performances, initiatives, dance workshops and events
that leave a transformative experience. Our VISION is to inspire, impact, and
empower the artistic community all around the globe, and to create initiatives

that empower the global unheard voices in the current millennium.(""#VOIDS"" May 9th, 2015 at CPR / Photo Credit: Luis Nieto Dickens)------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Why an INDIEGOGO Campaign?VALLETO made its first company debut thanks to the amazing supporters who
believed in us and donated through a crowdfunding platform back in
2014. Thankfully, their support was able to take us even further than
promised and we have accomplished so much!
We premiered our first
season “Inner Dialogues” at The Kraine Theater in the East
Village with a FULL HOUSE.
We created 5 dance workshops with guest dance artists.
We performed in Washington Square Park.
We hosted a screening event for french artist JR called ""ELLIS"" and opened up a public conversation about Immigration.
We created and performed our second season called
“#VOIDS” at the acclaimed theater ""Center for Performance Research"" in Brooklyn.
We developed an improvisation, ballet and contemporary workshop in Cd. Juarez, Mexico.
We introduced Gaga Technique in a workshop in Mexico.
We were selected to be part of the “Sublet Series” at HERE Arts in
SOHO where “Lesson Unlearned” made its debut successfully at the Dorothy B.
Williams Theater.
We have created free events including our “Equality
First” conversations where the public is invited.

WANT TO SEE IT WITH YOUR OWN EYES?BELOW is a recapitulation:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------THIS CAMPAIGN WAS CREATED TO MAKE OUR 3RD SEASON POSSIBLE IN ITS FINAL STAGE AND THE BEGINNING OF OUR 4TH SEASONSince
our founding, it has been challenging to survive on a daily basis.
Studio rentals and production costs are really expensive! Without a
proper studio we can't rehearse and without specific production
requests, our performances wouldn't be the same!Dance is an
expensive enterprise that is not properly funded. But, with your support
we can expand our vision in more communities!!
VALLETO aims to find new opportunities and more possibilities for dance theater.
BUT .... WHERE WILL THE FUNDS GO?
The funds earned from
this campaign will go specifically towards production costs such as:
costume creation.
dancers fees
studio rentals (The most expensive!!)
theater rental
lighting designer
graphic designer
collaboration and performance taking place on September
video production
#VOIDS May, 9 2015 (Photo by: Luis Nieto Dickens)
We are professional dancers who work, study, and came to New York to make a difference- we have a busy life in order to survive
column2: but our passion is DANCE and we are committed to make this vision a reality. We want to make our supporters happy and proud."" - VALLETO Team

Español
#VOIDS May 9, 2015 - Fotografía
: Luis Nieto Dickens
Valeria Yvette
González, Directora Artística de VALLETO, se encontró a sí misma cuando
descubrió su pasión por crear movimiento, la mente inconsciente y su gran deseo
de marcar una diferencia en el mundo de la danza, y como resultado fundó
VALLETO en 2014. Muchas de sus experiencias, y encuentros culturales en el
mundo artístico la llevo a crear VALLETO, una compañía de danza contemporánea
que también apoya y promueve la diversidad cultural en el mundo de la danza y
los derechos de igualdad en el mundo. Como bailarina mexicana, su visión es
empoderar la danza contemporánea y poder darle una voz fuerte al arte en países
donde el arte es visto como un “hobby.”
Fotografía:Melissa Gamache
VALLETO es una compañía de danza contemporánea que emplea raíces de técnicas
como Gaga, Hip-hop y Ballet. Nuestros espectáculos representan emociones e
historias creadas desde una exploración profunda de lo que la mente
inconsciente esconde en el cuerpo. Durante el proceso de crear cada coreografía
exploramos, jugamos y observamos intensamente nuestra imaginación, nuestros
sentidos, nuestras historias y sobre todo emociones.
Fotografía: Melissa Gamache
VALLETO
también narra diferentes temas de forma abstracta o cómica, para así mismo
transmitir de diferentes formas la relación que hay entre un cuerpo, una
realidad objetiva y la mente inconsciente en esta nueva era digital.
Nuestra MISIÓN es
crear espectáculos, iniciativas de empoderamiento, cursos de danza y eventos
que dejen una experiencia transformativa. Nuestra Visión es
inspirar, crear un impacto y empoderar la comunidad artística mundialmente, y
crear iniciativas donde apoyemos globalmente a voces que aún son ignoradas en
este milenio.
¿Y por qué una
campaña INDIEGOGO?
VALLETO logró su debut
en el 2014 gracias al apoyo de gente que creyó en nuestra misión! Ahora podemos
decir y comprobar que hemos logrado mucho más de lo prometido!
VALLETO logró su debut
en el 2014 gracias al apoyo de gente que creyó en nuestra misión! Ahora podemos
decir y comprobar que hemos logrado mucho más de lo prometido!
Estrenamos nuestra primera temporada con “Inner
Dialogues” en el “Kraine Theater” en el “East Village” en Nueva York donde
tuvimos casa llena.
Creamos 5 cursos de danza donde también invitamos a
coreógrafos emergentes.
Nos presentamos en Washington Square Park.
Fuimos anfitriones de un evento creado por el artista
francés JR y emitimos el cortometraje ""ELLIS"" donde también
empezamos una conversación sobre migración.
Creamos y presentamos nuestra 2nda temporada llamada
“#VOIDS” en el aclamado teatro “Center for Performance Research” en
Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
Creamos un taller de improvisación y danza
contemporánea en Cd. Juárez, Chih. donde introducimos la técnica “Gaga.”
Fuimos seleccionados para ser parte del aclamado
“Summer Sublet Series”  de el teatro “HERE” en SOHO Nueva York. Donde
presentamos “Lesson Unlearned” por primera vez.
Hemos creado eventos incluyendo nuestras “Equality
First” conversaciones donde el público puede participar y traer consigo
algún tema pertinente a igualdad y diversidad.
¿QUIERES VERLO CON TUS PROPIOS OJOS?

The Ganymede Ensemble is a classical theatre troupe comprised solely of young women. They will present their swift, accessible and classical rendition of Romeo and Juliet for three FREE PERFORMANCES only: September 5, 6 and 12 at 2pm @ Kadish Park in Milwaukee, WI.

The Ensemble offers a unique opportunity for accomplished young actresses to play male roles. Current ensemble members range in age from 14 to 18. 

Members are not asked to pay a fee to participate. In lieu of this, the program is supported by personal sponsorship of the actresses and crowd funding.

Funds raised will cover administrative and marketing costs, set, props, costumes...and of course an ample amount of faux mustaches and beards!

We thank you kindly in advance for your support and warmly invite you to join us for a performance!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""> <h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column8: >The AZ legislature and governor
column9: target=""_blank"">reduced the state’s investment in the arts

column1: <b style=""font-size: 16px
column4:
>

As a direct result, the maximum award available to Orange Theatre through the state's Community Investment Grant program was cut by 33% this year: from $3000 to $2000.

column1: We were honored to receive this grant once again this summer, but this new, lower maximum award has left us with a $1000 shortfall.

The Community Investment Grant is one of the only public sources of general operating support for AZ arts organizations like us. This is vital funding that helps us afford to keep the lights on and pay rent at our performance space–not to mention the many other less-than-sexy costs of running a theatre company (insurance! internet!)... You know the drill: we can't do the cool stuff without paying for the basics.

If the state legislature and governor aren’t going to support the arts in AZ, we need the public to step in to fill the gap.
column5: >We need to raise $1000 in the next 30 days
column8:
> to replace the lost state funding and produce our 2015-16 season.

Why:  This has been a big year for Orange. Our shows are selling out. Last August, we were invited to bring one of our productions to New York. We’ve successfully renovated a warehouse to create a great new venue in downtown Phoenix. We launched the Digital Performance Lab program in June and prototyped a new technology for the stage. We're taking new artistic risks with every production. We want to keep up this progress, but if we don't make up the state funding we lost this year, we will have to cut back our programs. We don’t want to do that, and we don't think you want us to do that, either.
column9: >How:  Please give if you can, and share this campaign with your friends
column11: >Help us prove there are people in AZ who support the arts and have a vision for a vibrant, creative scene in Phoenix.
column12:
>Thank you so much.

-Orange Theatre
","One month. One thousand dollars.What happened:  The AZ legislature and governor reduced the state’s investment in the arts by $1 million for fiscal year 2016.

column1: As a direct result, the maximum award available to Orange Theatre through the state's Community Investment Grant program was cut by 33% this year: from $3000 to $2000.
We were honored to receive this grant once again this summer, but this new, lower maximum award has left us with a $1000 shortfall.

The Community Investment Grant is one of the only public sources of general operating support for AZ arts organizations like us. This is vital funding that helps us afford to keep the lights on and pay rent at our performance space–not to mention the many other less-than-sexy costs of running a theatre company (insurance! internet!)... You know the drill: we can't do the cool stuff without paying for the basics.If the state legislature and governor aren’t going to support the arts in AZ, we need the public to step in to fill the gap.We need to raise $1000 in the next 30 days to replace the lost state funding and produce our 2015-16 season.Why:  This has been a big year for Orange. Our shows are selling out. Last August, we were invited to bring one of our productions to New York. We’ve successfully renovated a warehouse to create a great new venue in downtown Phoenix. We launched the Digital Performance Lab program in June and prototyped a new technology for the stage. We're taking new artistic risks with every production. We want to keep up this progress, but if we don't make up the state funding we lost this year, we will have to cut back our programs. We don’t want to do that, and we don't think you want us to do that, either.How:  Please give if you can, and share this campaign with your friends. Help us prove there are people in AZ who support the arts and have a vision for a vibrant, creative scene in Phoenix.Thank you so much.-Orange Theatre",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns
|","Phoenix, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/orange-theatre-asks-for-money/pica

Fundraiser Summary
<ul>
<li>Hello! I'm Kookie Daniels 30 year old <u>""FOUNDER &amp
• This campaign is to raise funding towards an EXPANSION of ""Kookie's Dance Den""

• Good things need to exist. Kookie's Dance Den is a  ""GOOD THING"". Expanding this studio facility is going to CHANGE the dynamic of so many lives, not only in ILLINOIS but around the world (physically and virtually)! We want to grow so we can reach more people, which means CHANGING more people. The styles of dance &
column2: events we host at the ""Kookies Dance Den"" increase smiles, self - esteem and builds people UP! It's NOT your avergae dance studio, just some hobby or a bucket-list spot. Over 3,000 reviews has proved this place is MANDATORY &
column3: NEEDED. Self- care is needed. It's not an option anymore. Kookie's Dance Den has saved romantic relationships, built friendships, treated abuse victims, stopped suicides, and created more confident people! 8 counts here are MEDICINE, we teach people more than dance. There is NO places like this. Founded in 2012 this brand has continued to thrive, won awards and has been featured on several media and T.V outlets.  After the pandemic, we took a loss. However, we fought through it, and decided to go HARDER...because if we CLOSED, many people's ""ME TIME"" will stop. We often don't understand how important.. people feeling good about themselves truly is. Teaching people to do more, be more and give more is a life skill that changes the world. Kookie's Dance Den wants to continue changing the world. We are now accepting donations towards expanding so we can keep changing the world, one 8 count at a time!

Hello! I'm Kookie Daniels 30 year old ""FOUNDER & ENTREPRENEUR""!
This campaign is to raise funding towards an EXPANSION of ""Kookie's Dance Den""

Good things need to exist. Kookie's Dance Den is a  ""GOOD THING"". Expanding this studio facility is going to CHANGE the dynamic of so many lives, not only in ILLINOIS but around the world (physically and virtually)! We want to grow so we can reach more people, which means CHANGING more people. The styles of dance & events we host at the ""Kookies Dance Den"" increase smiles, self - esteem and builds people UP! It's NOT your avergae dance studio, just some hobby or a bucket-list spot. Over 3,000 reviews has proved this place is MANDATORY & NEEDED. Self- care is needed. It's not an option anymore. Kookie's Dance Den has saved romantic relationships, built friendships, treated abuse victims, stopped suicides, and created more confident people! 8 counts here are MEDICINE, we teach people more than dance. There is NO places like this. Founded in 2012 this brand has continued to thrive, won awards and has been featured on several media and T.V outlets.  After the pandemic, we took a loss. However, we fought through it, and decided to go HARDER...because if we CLOSED, many people's ""ME TIME"" will stop. We often don't understand how important.. people feeling good about themselves truly is. Teaching people to do more, be more and give more is a life skill that changes the world. Kookie's Dance Den wants to continue changing the world. We are now accepting donations towards expanding so we can keep changing the world, one 8 count at a time!
What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:
Our total goal is over 50k, but we are fundraising from our supporters 15k!
The perks for donating are FIRE! T-shirts, Free classes, Raffles and more!
We would LOVE to reach our 15k goal from YOU, however any amounts received are going towards the same goal of expansion!
Tier 1
You will receive: - 1 Raffle Ticket entered into a drawing to win a free class! Checkout & review all class information online at Kookiesdanceden.com!
Tier 2
You will receive: - 3 Raffle Ticket entries into a drawing to win a free class! + A 20% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com
Tier 3
You will receive: - 5 Raffle Ticket entries into a drawing to win a free class! + A 20% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com.
Tier 4
You will receive: - 2 Free “Guaranteed” classes (Value of $20 & under only).  + 30% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com + Signature Branded “T- Shirt” (Sizes XS - 3X)
Tier 5
You will receive: - 6 Free “Guaranteed” classes (Value of $20 & under only).+ 40% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com + Signature Branded “T- Shirt” (Sizes XS - 3X) -Kookie's ""Kalm Box"".
Tier 6

You will receive: - 1 month UNLIMITED membership to Kookie's Dance Den ( A $500 value) - 50% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com + Signature Branded “T- Shirt” (Sizes XS - 3X) + Kookie's ""Kalm Box"".
Tier 7

You will receive: - 2 months UNLIMITED membership to Kookie's Dance Den + 60% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com + Signature Branded “T- Shirt” (Sizes XS - 3X) + Kookie's ""Kalm Box"" + ""Sugar Kookie Shaper"" OR ""Sugar Kookie Sweatbelt""
Tier 8

You will receive: 3 months UNLIMITED membership + Signature Branded “T-Shirt” + Signature Branded ""Twerk Shorts"" -60% off coupon for: Thekookiekollection.com + Kookie’s ""Kalm Box"" + ""Sugar Kookie Shaper"" OR ""Sugar Kookie Sweatbelt"" + Entrepreneurs/Business owners will get a social media shoutout to the entire ""Kookie Brand"" audience #Willgrowyourbrand)
The Impact
Your contribution BIG OR SMALL counts. We appreciate it and YOU! You can be confident that your donation is going towards something amazing and will only benefit you or this world in the future.
Risks & Challenges

We have several other methods of raising funds for this expansion project. We are prepared for things to GO WRONG, they will.. that's life, BUT we have everything outlined to make sure this HAPPENS! Your donatin will NOT be invain, go towards anything BUT this expansion project.
Other Ways You Can Help
Everyone CANNOT donate monetary funds, We understand that: Here are some other ways to help us.
Share this CAMPAIGN on your social media.
Register for a class: Kookiesdanceden.com
Shop our store: Kookiesdanceden.com
Shop MY store: Thekookiekollection.com
View, like comment and share anything from my social media, the more people that know about my brand the better chance we have of reaching our goal!
Thank you! - Kookie",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

As actors, artists and sisters, we believe in lending ourselves to a higher cause through theater. We have dreamed of bringing David Auburn's play ""Proof"" to life not only because this play resonates with us on a deep level, it also brings to awareness the all-too-real struggles of families affected by cognitive disorders such as Alzheimer's.
We are aiming for $4,000 towards our production (New York is pricey, y'all) for theater rental, props, lighting, rehearsal space, rights to the play, costumes, sets and programs.

Here's where it gets important: No matter what, we will donate at least 30% of tickets sales to the New York City Chapter of the Alzheimer's Association. HOWEVER, if we reach and/or surpass our goal of $4,000, we will donate 50% of ticket sales!
You can help us by sharing this campaign on social media and by telling your friends and family!
Theater is nothing more than tribes sitting around a campfire and reflecting humanity back to each other through stories. We long to be a part of this in a way that gives back to our human story.

Who is SpiderWebShow?

SpiderWebShow is a nationally-connected, Kingston-based performance company that creates and curates live, digital art. We are led by Artistic Director Michael Wheeler, Creative Catalyst Sarah Garton Stanley, and Festival Director Adrienne Wong (Directors, Creators, Adventurers all). We’ve worked with more than 200 makers from coast-to-coast-to-coast and we’re dedicated to using the unlimited capacity of digital technology to bolster the voices of diverse and disruptive artists across the country. We’ve hosted Thought Residencies, a magazine on Canadian arts and culture called CdnTimes, and even invented CdnStudio, an online performance tool that creates digital space for artists working across distance. And now, we’re bringing the internet together IRL.
What the heck is foldA?

foldA is our first move from curating to creating space for live, digital performance. This year we started thinking: how can we engage artists across the country to unpack the possibilities and fears associated with the digital shift? How can we use our coast-to-coast-to-coast digital networks to invite creators to be excited about the future of live performance?

foldA makes space for artists and thought leaders to investigate and experiment within the digital realm. Everything we are doing is with digital in mind. Our website, powered by PLANK, puts mobile access first. Our welcome package is powered by Slack (read about us on the Slack blog). Audience feedback forms are submitted directly from your phone to the artists themselves. We’re opting out of print programs for sustainability’s sake.
foldA 2018 includes:
<li>
Performances: Shows that you can only see in Kingston that use digital technologies, live.
<li>
The StartUp: Conversations and challenges that build, design, and interrogate the next generation of digital live performance.
<li>
Livestreams: Many of our performances feature livestream technology, embracing distance as a key component of the digital realm.
foldA 2018 highlights:

• Live from the Stratford Festival, Mikaela Davies (Assistant Director) and Elissa Horscroft (Technical Director) in conversation with Keira Loughran take you behind the scenes of Robert Lepage’s Coriolanus.
<li>

Nina Lee Aquino, Jillian Keiley, Brendan Healy, Jay Dodge, Andrew D’Cruz, and Donna Michelle St. Bernard lend their voices to The StartUp, our Industry Series dedicated to unpacking challenges and opportunities in the digital age.
• Kingston hometown hero and hoser rap sensation B.Rich kicks off the festival by going ‘out fer a rip’ in the Isabel Concert Hall.
• Livestreamed from Citadel Theatre, comedian and certified insane person Jan Derbyshire turns an audience in Kingston into a mental health review board to help determine her sanity.
• We’re throwing a Silent Disco in Kingston’s Confederation Basin.
• West Coast legends The Electric Company Theatre are heading into residency with our friends at Thousand Islands Playhouse.
Consider foldA 2018 the first tweet in a thread. The first chapter in an e-book. We’re still buffering and we need your help to fully load in HD.

What is the future of foldA?

 

We have lofty dreams for foldA, but what else is new! In the future, we want to:
<ul>
• Offer more livestreams, connecting artists and audiences coast-to-coast-to-coast without ever leaving our neighbourhoods
• Grow partnerships with our friends at Luminato, the Thousand Islands Playhouse, the Citadel Theatre in Edmonton, and with other collaborators across the country.
• Provide more resources to creators and thought leaders who want to join us in Kingston IRL
• Work towards providing a ‘one size fits one’ approach to accessibility

Can’t donate, come to foldA 2018!

 

If funding foldA isn’t in the cards for you, join us IRL at foldA 2018 from June 19-22 at the Isabel Bader Centre for the Performing Arts in Kingston, ON and spread the word on social media.
FACEBOOK / TWITTER / INSTAGRAM

Short Summary

Paragon Prism is a start up arts collaborative organization which has been in existence since spring of 2014. It was created as a concept to allow artists of all types and walk of life to realize their dreams and have an outlet to perform and to better themselves. We have performed a single show in the summer of 2014 that was a resounding success. We obtained our business license in the winter of 2017. Our main goal at this moment in time is to obtain our own theatre space to provide people in our community with an outlet for their artistic pursuits. To that end, we are in the midst of producing The Rocky Horrow Show.  This production will be used as a fundraiser to raise funds to obtain and renovate a home that meet our needs.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>

• We are asking for 4000 dollars. The funds will be used in various different ways. 1500 will be used to retain our celebrity narrator,  Mark Patton who is giving us a discount. another 1500 will be used to pay for the rights. The additional 1000 wil be used on various stage and sound expenses. If you donate you will obtain a free ticket to this show and a free ticket to one of our future productions.
• Paragon Prism is a unique organization that believes in making each and every production unique.
• Even if we fall short of our goal, the funds will be used in conjunction with our own to obtain our goals.
The Impact

• Should Paragon succeed in this endeavor, we will provide our community with a successful theatre that will improve the economy of our state and also provide local artists with an opportunity to shine.
Other Ways You Can Help

• We understand that not everyone has the funds to donate even when you wish that you could and that's ok.  There are many other ways to help. Put the word out to everyone you know. volunteer to assist with staging. if you are an actor, feel free to ask about our future productions

<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >Throughout the country, performance and visual art companies took a significant financial hit during the pandemic.
column3: >Many lost their business or struggled to survive much like JM Productions. However, JM Productions is determined to come back bigger and better than ever!

column1: JM Productions has a 35 year reputation for bringing professional entertainment and recognized talent to Quincy and the South Shore.  Despite the challenges of the past year, we are determined to continue that tradition and make a big splash in 2021/2022! The new season is going to be epic, but without your support we may not be able to move forward with our exciting new plans.
<ul>
• The upcoming season will include Broadway Concerts, Cabaret Shows, Theatrical Events, and the ever popular Showboat Cruises from Squantum Point Park.
• To aid in this effort, JM Productions is asking for the support of its longtime allies and ambassadors to get the word out about this campaign and to contribute to this exciting cause!
• We want you to come to our shows and share in the joy that live performances bring to our community.
The Impact

Arts, culture, and creativity drive local economies. Any lasting damage to the creative sector will drastically undercut our culture, well-being, and quality of life in Quincy and on the South Shore. Your donation, no matter the size, will make a difference as JM Productions makes our big come back. From $5.00 - $5,000 your generous donation will be appreciated equally as it takes many supporters to create our performance art experiences!
<ul>

• JM Productions hires independent contractors, actors, musicians, sound technicians, lighting designers, graphic designers and PR staff. Your support will directly impact these professionals who have suffered so much throughout this pandemic.
• Bringing live shows to Quincy, will bring more people to Quincy and impact the local economy, aiding in the recovery of the pandemic.
• This campaign will ensure that Quincy audiences will have access to professional productions and performers, as JM Productions is the only company hiring this caliber of talent on the South Shore.
• So you see, YOUR support creates a domino effect and will spur economic growth in your community. The impact of your donation is significant and a win/win for all involved.
<h3>Risks &amp
Of course there are always risks and obstacles we face on the way to achieving our goal but your financial support helps to minimize these challenges.
<ul>
• Rebuilding our audiences after a 15 month hiatus is one of our biggest challenges. We intend to use a portion of each donation for marketing and PR to ensure our audiences know we are BACK.
• If we do not hit our fundraising goal we will scale back the season presenting fewer productions and events, not compromising on the quality of our professional productions.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute as it has been a difficult year, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
<ul>

• We respectively ask you to help ""get the word out"" as our ambassadors and make some ""NOISE"" about our campaign on your own social media platforms. Strength in numbers can put us over the top and your recommendation may make that difference.
• Remind your friends to pay it forward by sharing our campaign on their own social media platforms. You tell friends, they tell their friends and so on and so on!

Now it's your turn to take a bow. Thank you in advance for your support and we look forward to seeing you at the next JM Productions performance!

The team at Up Your Alley Productions need your help to make this very important Musical before

it’s too late. The generations that experienced the music from these great artists in the 60’s and 70’s certainly understand this phenomenon a little more than later generations, but we all deserve the opportunity to see this stage musical before it’s too late for some of us. It will also preserve this cultural meme and will continue to entertain and explain this elusive tragedy of rock n roll history forever.
• Auditions for the cast and crew, including Director etc. The sky is the limit on this production.
• Bigger and better stage sets and visual effects. The more money we raise the bigger and better the musical becomes, and the more talent we can attract.
• Theatre and standing charges.
• Office, is inclusive of staff costs, Executive Producer, rights, insurance etc.
• Advertising, marketing and graphic design.

column2:
>Questions about perks

We know when you help fund the musical, the first thing on your mind probably wasn’t how long will it take to get your perks. 

All the physical perks will be sent within three months of the funding closure. Other things will be dependent on auditions, rehearsals and the musical opening.                                                                         

You can make multiple pledges on Indiegogo with a single account. Just make sure you use the same email address and login, so we’ll know that all your perks are meant to go to the same person.
column3:
>Shipping

When the campaign is over, we’ll be contacting all contributors, where you’ll be able to tell us your shipping address, your perk preferences, and any other details we need. And you can tell us your T-Shirt size, and we’ll answer any questions you have.

WHO ARE WE?

Located in San Francisco, CA, Left Coast Theatre Company, is a network of more than 100 LGBTQ and allied playwrights, directors, actors, and theater technicians passionate about creating and sharing the stories of the queer community through theater. We believe that the power of theater to tell the stories of the LGBTQ and allied community is vital to fostering understanding and acceptance in a time of change.
WHAT ARE WE DOING?

In the fall of 2019 we will producing Paul Rudnick’s The Most Fabulous Story Ever Told. This play tells the story of Adam and Eve, only it's Adam and Steve, who then meet Jane and Mable, and together the first two homosexual couple in the world explore 2,000 years of human history from their perspective. While this is not a new play, it is stylistically innovative and definitely timely.
WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?
San Francisco is a difficult city to produce indie theater - with rehearsal rentals, venue rentals, and production costs such as set materials, costumes and props skyrocketing daily.

Contributors will help us achieve the successful production of the show by relieving the burden of rehearsal, venue, and administrative costs and allowing us to focus on production and artist costs. This show is more complex than any of our previous shows, with more intricate costumes, sets, and props than we have built in the past.
WHAT DO WE NEED HELP WITH?
In order for Left Coast to produce this show successfully we need some assistance in relieving some housekeeping costs:
<ol>
• Venue rental costs: $2,500
• Rehearsal rentals costs: $1,500
• Administration costs (insurance, printing, marketing materials, etc.): $2,000

By contributing to these overhead costs we will be able to focus revenue funds on our production materials (costumes, props, set pieces, etc.) and our creative staff (actors, directors) and crew staff (stage managers, tech designers, etc.). Left Coast is a fully volunteer organization, with the ability to offer our incredible artists a stipend, but we always want to offer them more! For their dedication and hard work on this show we are hoping to be able to do that.
WHY IS THE SHOW IMPORTANT TO PRODUCE?

We believe this play specifically will have a unifying impact on our audience and community. Producing Fabulous Story in November 2019 ensures its themes dovetail with election season conversations as we gather for the holidays with deeply held (and often divergent) viewpoints. Fabulous Story queers the notion of Christmas as an American institution built on the traditional, nuclear family, demonstrating how truly Christmas can be for every family—and by extension manifesting the necessity for each of us to have trusted “families” (whether related by blood, world view, or just plain love) to keep us strong through life’s toughest trials and share the blessings of life’s greatest joys.

It's important to remind the San Francisco Bay Area that we can still love and accept our religious siblings and friends, even if we don’t see eye-to-eye, especially around the holidays. We hope this production will unite our community to shore it up for the stress of 2020.
CAN'T CONTRIBUTE?

column1: ","WHO ARE WE?

Located in San Francisco, CA, Left Coast Theatre Company, is a network of more than 100 LGBTQ and allied playwrights, directors, actors, and theater technicians passionate about creating and sharing the stories of the queer community through theater. We believe that the power of theater to tell the stories of the LGBTQ and allied community is vital to fostering understanding and acceptance in a time of change.
WHAT ARE WE DOING?

In the fall of 2019 we will producing Paul Rudnick’s The Most Fabulous Story Ever Told. This play tells the story of Adam and Eve, only it's Adam and Steve, who then meet Jane and Mable, and together the first two homosexual couple in the world explore 2,000 years of human history from their perspective. While this is not a new play, it is stylistically innovative and definitely timely.
WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?
San Francisco is a difficult city to produce indie theater - with rehearsal rentals, venue rentals, and production costs such as set materials, costumes and props skyrocketing daily.

Contributors will help us achieve the successful production of the show by relieving the burden of rehearsal, venue, and administrative costs and allowing us to focus on production and artist costs. This show is more complex than any of our previous shows, with more intricate costumes, sets, and props than we have built in the past.
WHAT DO WE NEED HELP WITH?
In order for Left Coast to produce this show successfully we need some assistance in relieving some housekeeping costs:
Venue rental costs: $2,500
Rehearsal rentals costs: $1,500
Administration costs (insurance, printing, marketing materials, etc.): $2,000

By contributing to these overhead costs we will be able to focus revenue funds on our production materials (costumes, props, set pieces, etc.) and our creative staff (actors, directors) and crew staff (stage managers, tech designers, etc.). Left Coast is a fully volunteer organization, with the ability to offer our incredible artists a stipend, but we always want to offer them more! For their dedication and hard work on this show we are hoping to be able to do that.
WHY IS THE SHOW IMPORTANT TO PRODUCE?

We believe this play specifically will have a unifying impact on our audience and community. Producing Fabulous Story in November 2019 ensures its themes dovetail with election season conversations as we gather for the holidays with deeply held (and often divergent) viewpoints. Fabulous Story queers the notion of Christmas as an American institution built on the traditional, nuclear family, demonstrating how truly Christmas can be for every family—and by extension manifesting the necessity for each of us to have trusted “families” (whether related by blood, world view, or just plain love) to keep us strong through life’s toughest trials and share the blessings of life’s greatest joys.

It's important to remind the San Francisco Bay Area that we can still love and accept our religious siblings and friends, even if we don’t see eye-to-eye, especially around the holidays. We hope this production will unite our community to shore it up for the stress of 2020.

Our Story

""Petrified Lightning"" tells the story of a happenstance seaside meeting, which forces two strangers into a tumultuous exploration of fear and loss. Together they must decide to experience the unknown or forever be petrified by it.

A note from the playwright: I wrote ""Petrified Lightning"" a year after my mother was diagnosed with terminal lung cancer.  I wanted to explore my seemingly innate inability to share my grief and fear with the people closest to me. After my mother passed away in August 2019, I began revising the piece. ""Petrified Lightning"" will be premiering at the Strawberry One-Act Festival in February 2020. I am fortunate to have Jacob S. Louchheim directing and starring as Thaddeus, while I will be portraying Susanna.
What We Need
We are hoping to raise $2,500 to help defray the costs associated with participation in the festival
Rehearsal Space: $600 will be spent on booking space for 31 hours of rehearsal at Shetler Studios

Actors: $1,380. We think it's important to pay your artists--even if that means paying yourself! We will be working for New York City minimum wage, which is $15 per hour. The $690 per actor includes rehearsal, tech rehearsals, and all performances during the festival.
Sound and Lighting Technician: $200 will be used to pay our sound and light technician, who is responsible for designing and running our sound and lighting for the show.
Costumes and set: $120
Miscellaneous: $200. Things happen and we think it's important to have a little wiggle room for when the tide comes in!
Any additional money raised will be used as reimbursement for the $400 festival fee, as well as any future productions of ""Petrified Lightning.""
About the Festival

The Strawberry One-Act Festival is a play competition in which the audience and the theatre's judges cast their votes to select the best play of the season.  Twice a year, hundreds of plays from across the country are submitted for the competition.  Plays move from the 1st Round to the Finals. The finals are judged by a theatre producer, literary agent, acting agent, and a casting director. The playwright of the winning play receives $1,500 and the opportunity to have a full-length play developed by the Riant.  The awards to be presented are Best Play, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Costume Design, Best Set Design, and Best Video Diary Short Film.
Other Ways You Can Help

We would love to see everyone at the show! ""Petrified Lightning"" will be performed on February 12th at 8:30 pm and February 13th at 6 pm. Tickets can be purchased online for $25 or in-person at the box office for $27. Tickets can be purchased at the link below:
https://www.therianttheatre.com/item.php?pid=1411
