Campaign Overview

We are excited to share the world premiere of Cynosemma: A Dirge from the Dog’s Tomb, a new interdisciplinary operatic ritual ripped from the Hecuba myth. Though this project takes inspiration from an Ancient Greek myth, its exploration of how the oppressed soul reclaims its strength amidst unthinkable brutality is palpably relevant. While we want to provoke with questions regarding violence, misogyny, grief, corruption and revenge, we ultimately seek to transcend the torment of Hecuba’s pain and ignite a communal catharsis for artists and audience alike.

WHO WE ARE

Cynosemma is a joint project between Los Angeles based Overtone Industries and theatre company By The Souls of Our Feet (BTSOOF). The members of BTSOOF (Megan Breen, Kristin Condon, Nathan Singh and Sabina Zuniga Varela) all attended USC’s School for Dramatic Arts.  After the invigorating catharsis and connection of their inaugural production in 2013 - Serpentine Pink - ,  they formed a collective hell-bent on creating visceral and poetic theatre experiences. Overtone Industries began 40 years ago by Artistic Director O-Lan Jones as a way to develop and present new multidisciplinary operas and music theatre, bringing to life vivid, original stories and myths. The shared mission of these two groups made it an obvious choice for collaboration, and the beginnings of Cynosemma were born.

PROJECT HISTORY

We have been developing this show since 2017, starting with informal workshops. The first portion of the show, stations 1-3, were presented in 2018 for five sold-out nights at the Son of Semele Theater. The workshop performance received beautiful reviews from both STAGE RAW and the LA TIMES. Now we are asking you to help support the ultimate phase of development and the premiere performance, scheduled for the summer of 2020.

WHY THIS PROJECT

This primitive opera, with a grieving but resilient and raw female protagonist, tackles difficult questions concerning society’s gender norms, allowing the artists and communities who engage with it to reconsider any limited attitudes towards women and their roles in the spiritual, social, and political arenas
column2:
to tell stories in which the female protagonists are strong, complex and act upon their agency in a powerful way, reflecting and celebrating the progress we have made in 2019 regarding gender issues and women’s rights, as well as stirring us to keep moving forward.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT WE ARE PROVIDING

Your donations will help us secure rehearsal space, provide supplies for costumes and props, and most importantly, pay a decent wage to our eight excellent performers and creative artists as they commit their time and energy to bringing this revelatory work to life. Only about 25% of the opera’s cost will come from ticket sales, and only another 25% percent will come from grants. We are relying on our community of theater lovers, people who believe in the transformative power of the stage, to make this show happen.

You can be a vital part of bringing this important retelling and reclaiming of the Hecuba myth into today’s world. In a time when there is so much devastation in the world, artists, audiences and supporters can collect in the sacredness of the theatrical space and reclaim Hecuba’s story of devastation to release the pain, fear and anxiety that oppressors inflict upon us, setting us on a path towards healing. Through the enacting and witnessing of ritual theatre in a sacred space that aims to heal, we can come together in a communally spiritual way to replenish any spiritual drought.

We are offering our donors some fun and imaginative perks for their support, including ways to attend the performances, take pieces of the show home with you, and even commission brand new works of art.

Donations of any amount make a pivotal difference! Even a donation of $20 is an important step in us reaching our ultimate goal. We also truly appreciate everyone who will share this project and campaign with their community of people who are equally enthusiastic about visceral, mythic theatre.

Thank you for your support! We can’t wait to share this show with you next year!

On Site is a one act comedy about the life of Derek Setliff, the gay Michael Scott version of a property manager. On Site was originally a 13 minute comedic mockumentary pilot I wrote and produced, and from that, I developed a 30 minute one-act play which will make its premier this summer at FRINGE FEST!!!!

In reality, Derek is a heightened version of myself. Like Derek, I am a property manager. Oh, and also I came out of the closet later in life. In my writing, I want to explore what it feels like to be yourself and question if others will accept that true version of you. One challenge many gay men experience, myself included, is that feeling of stunted emotional growth. While many people start exploring dating and their sexuality closer to puberty, people in the closet are deprived of that exploration in an open way until they come out. It’s important to me to produce a show about a 30-something gay male trying to both be himself and also find a genuine connection with others.
As it turns out, producing a play is challenging, y’all, and because I care more about getting butts in seats than I do about making money, I have 2 questions to answer:
<ul>
• How many discounted tickets can I give away?
• How many free tickets can I give away?
In order to answer those questions, I gotta take a look at my budget:
<ul>
• Hollywood Fringe Registration: $300
<li>The Space: $1,037<ul>
• 5 performance slots
• 2 hours of tech time
• 1 tech person
• Insurance
<li>Publicity: $500<ul>
• Programs
• Posters
• Postcards
• Finge Festival Ads
<li>Misc: $300<ul>
• Food for actors
• Props / Set pieces
Total: $1,837

Technically, I need to sell 154 full price tickets to break even. This means as of today, I can give away discounted or free tickets to 6 people. That’s not so great, and that’s ONLY if we sell the rest of the seats at full price. This is a lot of pressure, and again I care more about getting butts in seats than I do about money. So, this is where you come in:

With your help, my goal is to raise $1,500 to help offset these numbers. If you help me bring in $1,500, then I only need to sell 29 full price seats in order to break even. That means I can give free or discounted tickets to up to 104 people! That makes it that much more likely that we will, in fact, sell out.

Here’s where you come in. If you donate $25, I will send you a code for 1 ticket to see On Site! If you donate $50, you will get a code for 2 tickets, and so on, and so on. Not only does your money get you the opportunity to see the premier of On Site, but it also helps us . . . wait for it . . . GET MORE BUTTS IN SEATS!
Thank you for your support. I love you!

THE COMPANY-Plain Jane Theatre is a Sterling award winning company that has been producing delightful and compelling musicals for Edmonton audiences since 2010 including 'Working', 'Wish You Were Here-Noel Coward Revue', 'A New Brain',and 'It's a Bird! It's a Plane! It's Superman!'. Our mandate has been to focus on the immense talent in our city while capturing the spirit and relevance of this great genre. Please find out more about us our website- www.plainjanetheatre.com

THE SHOW- 'AH, ROMANCE'  is a brand new revue filled with some of the finest songs, dances and other passionate musings from musicals that makes you understand 'romance' on a whole new level. Starring the wonderful and talented cast- Jocelyn Ahlf, Jason Hardwick, Madelaine Knight, Gianna Read and Ron Pederson! 

Directed by Kate Ryan with music direction by David Fraser, choreography by Cindy Kerr.

Performances held at the beautiful Varscona Theatre, February 15-25, 2017. 

Tickets are available now at Tix on the Square:

https://boxoffice.tixonthesquare.ca/single/PSDe...

THE CHALLENGE- In the past, we've been very fortunate to have generous support from funding programs to help build these unique musical experiences. This year, the company of 12 professional artists are without funding but still passionately committed to presenting a new and exciting evening of entertainment for Edmonton audiences with 'Ah, Romance'. However, there are many costs that we cannot avoid to make sure the show goes up. This includes our theatre rental to our sound, costumes, set and programs and more. So we are reaching out to you to help us get the show up and keep us singing!

THE PERKS- We value your donations greatly and would like to offer you some perks for our thanks. With Valentines Day on the Tuesday before our opening, we thought you could celebrate with tickets to a performance as well lots of other 'romantic' treats waiting for you at the theatre. And with a generous donation of $200 or more-we will even dedicate a song to you.

We are thrilled with all donations! Every bit helps!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR SUPPORTING LIVE THEATRE!

IT'S AN EXPERIENCE THAT EVERYONE NEEDS TO HAVE IN THEIR LIVES!

Please visit our website and Facebook page for up date information on the show. 

https://www.plainjanetheatre.com

https://www.facebook.com/plainjanetheatre/?fref=ts

We need your help!
Our rehearsals have gone great, we have an AMAZING cast and an exceptional play about love, relationships and Jazz.
But...
We have had some funding fall through at the last minute and desperately need the money to get up to Edinburgh.
Can you help us? No donation is too small
Seriously every penny counts.
Oh no, what's happened?

It's that nightmare scenario where you're a few weeks away from bringing a show to the world famous Edinburgh Fringe but you have to find that final installment for your accommodation fee, because a funding has not come through, otherwise you'll have no where to live for two weeks.
A play with jazz, art and love!
column3: >Ever been in love? Ever broken up with that love only to still remember that person years later and wonder what their up to? Ever decided against your better judgement to pay them a visit? Pale Imitations looks at a relationship that ended 10 years ago and what happens when one character plucks up the courage to go and visit his ex, even though he is about to get married the next day. Pale Imitations will premiere at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival at the Space Triplex, Venue 38 between 15th-27th August at 7.10pm.

column2: >Can you help? We've raised a whopping £5000 through self funding and grants from the Fenton Arts Trust and Gane Trust. And now we need to raise the final installment for our accommodation fees. No donation is too small.

column1: Why do you need the money?
Our final accommodation fees are due by the 14th August, if we do not have the final amount we will not have anywhere to live during our stay.

So far we have had some great buzz about the play, that has taken 2 years in the making with the possiblity of further bookings in the 2017, we need to get to Edinburgh so we do not lose our slot and so all the great work our talented cast and crew have put in won't be in vain.
Who you will be helping:
With an original live jazz soundtrack music supplied by a fantastic composer Nazarene Mighty, directed by Olorunfemi Fagunwa, Assisted by Jack Silver and written by Keshia Watson.
Cast Members include
Simone McIntyre as Indianna
Jerome Wise as Ramone
Alexander Kiffin as Carl
What cast have said:
“This is a play I really want to do, it not only is something that is deeply creative and something to sink our teeth into, but also makes us feel hopeful about a career in theatre.”
You are great! whether you donate or not, if you can spread the word, tell your friends, family and collegues about us, no amount is too small.

Seriously every penny counts.
Oh no, what's happened?

It's that nightmare scenario where you're a few weeks away from bringing a show to the world famous Edinburgh Fringe but you have to find that final installment for your accommodation fee, because a funding has not come through, otherwise you'll have no where to live for two weeks.

A play with jazz, art and love! What's the play about? Ever been in love? Ever broken up with that love only to still remember that person years later and wonder what their up to? Ever decided against your better judgement to pay them a visit? Pale Imitations looks at a relationship that ended 10 years ago and what happens when one character plucks up the courage to go and visit his ex, even though he is about to get married the next day. Pale Imitations will premiere at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival at the Space Triplex, Venue 38 between 15th-27th August at 7.10pm.

Can you help? We've raised a whopping £5000 through self funding and grants from the Fenton Arts Trust and Gane Trust. And now we need to raise the final installment for our accommodation fees. No donation is too small.
Why do you need the money?
Our final accommodation fees are due by the 14th August, if we do not have the final amount we will not have anywhere to live during our stay.

So far we have had some great buzz about the play, that has taken 2 years in the making with the possiblity of further bookings in the 2017, we need to get to Edinburgh so we do not lose our slot and so all the great work our talented cast and crew have put in won't be in vain.
Who you will be helping:
With an original live jazz soundtrack music supplied by a fantastic composer Nazarene Mighty, directed by Olorunfemi Fagunwa, Assisted by Jack Silver and written by Keshia Watson.
Cast Members include
Simone McIntyre as Indianna
Jerome Wise as Ramone
Alexander Kiffin as Carl
What cast have said:
“This is a play I really want to do, it not only is something that is deeply creative and something to sink our teeth into, but also makes us feel hopeful about a career in theatre.”
You are great! whether you donate or not, if you can spread the word, tell your friends, family and collegues about us, no amount is too small.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","London, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pale-imitations-at-edinburgh-fringe-shortfall/pica

What is Shockheaded Peter ? (Nov 29-Dec 15)

Shockheaded Peter is a wild multi-discipline (puppetry, music, pantomime, melodrama) theatrical ride. The show was originally built around The Tiger Lillies’ musical interpretation of the 19th century German children's book of cautionary poems Struwwelpeter by Heinrich Hoffmann.  In 1998 Julian Crouch, Phelim McDermott, and Michael Morris joined forces with the ingenious cabaret-style London trio, The Tiger Lillies, to create what was to become a smash hit in Leeds, later transferring to London where it was nominated for 5 Olivier awards, and winning the award for Best Entertainment. The production then took New York by storm, being described by the New York Times as:  “truly fearsome or really ridiculous…  oh, so deliciously, both… the silliest and the most sinister show in town. It is also… one of the smartest… Few shows have ever been as good at being bad… It gets under your skin and stays there.”  To get a taste of the original production by the Tiger Lillies et al., please check out YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TOVSp-fYUQc
The photo of the Tiger Lillies in the video has been used by permission and for the fascinating story of The Tiger Lillies please check out their website at:
https://www.tigerlillies.com/
Who is Theatre Inconnu (and Friends) ?
http://www.theatreinconnu.com

Theatre Inconnu was born in 1978 in Victoria, BC, Canada and since then we have produced over 130 shows, covering all genres and theatrical disciplines, with a focus on alternative theatre. As a collective, Theatre Inconnu has a proud history of showcasing the talent of young aspiring actors with seasoned veterans, often giving these recent theatre school graduates their first taste of artistic independence. Shows like Shockheaded Peter have defined the nature of our work:  offerings that local audiences would otherwise never get to see.  While musical theatre does not make up the majority of our presentations we have surprised the city with: the world stage premiere of Murray Gold’s (the genius behind the music for Dr. Who) Kafka the Musical, as well as the Canadian Premiere of Tom Waits’ musical Alice (based on the Lewis Carroll books).  Shockheaded Peter will be one of the most ambitious and unorthodox shows we have tackled.  The musical accompaniment for these previous productions has come from the incredible trio known as The Party on High Street, who will be joining us again on Shockheaded Peter.  You couldn’t hope to meet a more talented and eclectic group of virtuoso musicians.  Please check them out at:
https://www.facebook.com/thepartyonhighstreet/

And for Shockheaded Peter we have another special surprise.  Gemini Award winning puppeteer Timothy Gosley will create the puppets.  You may know Mr. Gosley from his work with The Muppets on Fraggle Rock and Sesame Street, but Timothy is also respected internationally as an amazing solo performer, continually challenging audiences and pushing the boundaries of puppetry.
Why We Need Your Help !

Theatre Inconnu has access to the talent, and has the drive to make Shockheaded Peter a show that this city will long remember, but in order to achieve the full impact we need your help.  The highly theatrical nature of the show cries out for great costumes, finely crafted puppets, excellent musicianship and acting, and extraordinary sets and props.  The cost of doing justice to this show will exceed the modest financial support we generally receive.  Any amount you chose to donate towards this project will be very, very much appreciated.  By helping to fund Shockheaded Peter you will be helping us to continue providing our audiences with innovative theatre, as well as providing exciting opportunities to local theatre artists.
How Your Donation Will Help !
Funds received will go directly towards:

$2,000-costume material and construction
$1,000- prop building
$3,000-set construction
$1,200-puppetry construction
$6,000-artist stipends
$1,500-marketing
Even if we don't reach the full amount - the show goes on regardless: we just want it  to be an EXTRAORDINARY show!  So whether you donate a little or a lot - Shockheaded Peter is coming to town!

As a registered Canadian Charity, Theatre Inconnu will issue tax receipts to all Canadian donors who give $25 or more.

 

And if you can't contribute monetarily....

but would love to see as many people as possible ""Shocked"" by Shockheaded Peter, please spread the word through social media as far and wide as you can. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Who We Are

The Anthropologists is dedicated to the collaborative creation of investigative theatre that inspires action. Rooted in research and community engagement and shaped by contemporary dance and physical theatre techniques, we're committed to exploring current social topics from an anthropological perspective in order to break down and unleash cultural discoveries.
What We Made

NO MAN'S LAND was inspired by a small article in the news about Jeremiah Heaton and his quest to grant his daughter's wish. In trying to tell this story and expose its follies, we began to turn the mirror on ourselves and delve into our own pitfalls as artists and humans. We discovered that sometimes the art is in the art-making. After a series of workshops and a successful first draft at Dixon Place, NO MAN'S LAND is ready to launch its full run. We believe in the story we are telling and the dialogue we hope it ignites. We can't wait to bring it to TheaterLab and we need your help to make it happen.
How You Help Us
Making a play is challenging, but actually putting it on stage can be daunting. Luckily we can lean on our amazing community to help us.
Here is what your contributions will give us:
<ul>
• A set to welcome you into the world of the play
• Costumes to bring our characters to life
• Rehearsal space to work, practice and polish
• A theater to share our story with you
• Postcards to keep the details
• Stipends to keep the collaborators fed
How You Help Others
We believe that theater can inspire action and we'd like it to inspire action in us. Your generosity will be paid forward  in the form of donations of our team's time, goods and skills.

What is The Terrifying?

In a creepy little village on the cusp of modernity, two kids and their families are stalked by a ravening monster. How can you live with forces that want to destroy you? Maybe by cultivating some dark appetites of your own…

Written &
column2: directed by Julia Jarcho with live sound design by Ben Williams, minor theater’s The Terrifying premieres at Abrons Arts Center March 12-April 2, 2017. Starring Jess Barbagallo, Kim Gainer, Kristine Haruna Lee, Hanna Novak, and Pete Simpson
column3: with sets by Jason Simms, costumes by Ásta Bennie Hostetter, and lights by Barbara Samuels
column8:
production assistant Stephen Smith.

Who are we?

minor theater is a NYC company putting on plays written and directed by Julia Jarcho. The artists are downtown veterans including Jenny Seastone (NY Innovative Theatre Award, 2014), Ben Williams (Elevator Repair Service
column9:
OBIE 2012), and costume designer Ásta Bennie Hostetter (OBIE 2016). With dark humor and goofball precision, we camp out on the underbelly of pop culture. We tell the stories that don’t fit into the stories. We are champions of weird desire. We’ve been working together for a long time but we just started the company a couple of years ago and The Terrifying will be the first piece to premiere as a minor theater show.

And hey. There’s a lot of things that need your help right now, and we know downtown theater might not be at the top of the list. That totally makes sense. But if it does feel like an important time to support weird art—and those spaces of experiment where we can try to make something that feels really right, for once—we hope you’ll consider contributing. Either way, we hope you’ll come check out the show.

A month long tour around Scotland and Northern England, Champions Tale aims to create greater understanding and trust between cultures by blurring the lines between audience and performers and inviting genuine dialogue
column2:
listening, and understanding.

Champions Tale is produced in collaboration between Durban based Champions Dance Crew - who pass messages of unity through dance, and BE United - a Scottish SCIO &
column3:
South African NPO which works between Scotland and South Africa inspiring creative action, understanding and trust between cultures.

10 months so far in the making, Champions Tale tells the story of one young man’s life growing up in a rural South African Township. It is emotive, inspiring, delicate, entertaining, alive, and true in it’s purest form. Bringing together the passion, commitment and dreams of an already vibrant cross-cultural community, we request your support and participation in manifesting the final steps.

To get this tour on the road, we need to bring the 11 performers from South Africa across to Scotland, sustain ourselves (we are a cast of 15) throughout the duration of the tour, and create an active community of audiences and supporters from which the means to do this, and dialogue can emerge.
column5:
/>

 

There are many parts to play within the actualising of a production - at the bottom of this page we share and celebrate the ways in which people have contributed so far - every single role is vital and intrinsically of value. If you are inspired by what you read here, if right now you’re hearing a little voice within saying “Wow, this sounds amazing!” then read on to learn how you can become a part of making this production a reality.

 

To cover the costs of this tour we need £18,460.

Breaking this down means:

11 x standard UK visas - £979

11 x return flights - £6,600

Bus hire to travel to each venue - £1,830

Accommodation - £1,150

Food for the whole cast (15 people) - £1600

Promotional support, posters, flyers and  t-shirt printing - £1,250

Costumes for the show - £1,170

Creative Production £3,000

Total = £17,535

So we receive the amount we need we also want to cover the Indiegogo 5% fee of £923

 

Coming to a total costing of  £18,460

 

 

Will enable us to purchase what we need, and we are equally keen to hear from you if you have access to other resources that could facilitate the above, such as…

Do you have an extensive collection of air-miles which could fly all or some The Champions to us on the wings of your past holidays and business trips? Get in touch!

  Do you have a hostel, big house, dorms, or access to a campsite with tents we could use in any of the following locations: Edinburgh, Glasgow, Penrith, Dumfries and Galloway….?

Do you own a food establishment in any of the above locations and would enjoy contributing food, or filling our bellies for a meal or two? Would you like to cook us a meal and have us round to your house!?

 

 Are you an avid networker, skilled, or have a following and connections on social media? Then you can support us in the following ways:

what we post by following @_BeUnited_

We are pushing to connect with Virgin Atlantic - Richard Branson’s work ethic and values of growing projects within and for community resonates with our own, he is personally connected with South Africa, and we want their support with flights! Can you support us by contacting them and reposting our Facebook and twitter petitions to them?

We welcome and encourage any support that increases this project’s maximum exposure. Share with your family, friends, work colleagues, write about it and tag us, talk about it to those you meet and point them towards BE United.

 

 We’re looking for people to actively co-create this magic. Help us cultivate this transformational space by being at shows with a willingness to be moved and changed by your experience, integrating deeper understanding and connection across cultures.

 

 If you are interested in experiencing restorative dialogue, South African dance, song, traditions and cultures - come along to the shows, get your tickets now!

 

 

Impact of Champions Tale!

Social - Champions Tale is ground breaking work addressing head on real and very alive social topics of race and cultural difference that are a part of our personal daily lives and systemic normality! We invite your participation to engage in these realities in a new way that is fun, dynamic, and asks only that you bring yourself - as you are, and a willingness to be moved by your experience.

We will explore our cultures, traditions, our differences and similarities - holding all parts of each other in a safe, engaging, entertaining and creative way!

Organisational - For us, BE United - With 4 years experience, creating remarkable national and international projects that celebrate and Unite have been, and continue to be, our inspiration! BE United by name BE United by nature!  

 

“Since BE United’s inception I have dreamt of projects like this - to showcase some of the magic I have experienced in South Africa to my home country, my community, my family, my friends! What an honor, truly a dream come true! It is an opportunity to celebrate our respective cultures whilst also asking directly - what is it that still divides us? How can we unite?” - Emma P, BE United Co-founder.

Personal - There are many dreams held in this project, from those of each performer to travel overseas and showcase their talent and culture to new audiences in the UK
column6: to the BE United co-founders, Boysie &amp
column7:
Emma, to create work that inspires change and actively works towards a more united world! To the dialogue facilitator Emma Quayle who is inspired by the power of dialogue to connect and unite people, and the dreams of the families of all involved to see their kids follow their aspirations.

We all have our own purpose for being part of Champions Tale, this includes you! With each individual comes unique experiences and therefore many unique impacts that will ripple out into our communities, our environments, and the world we all share.

 

BE United past success!

BE United was established in 2013 in South Africa, we now operate in both South Africa and Scotland. We believe sharing and expressing creative talent leads to increased self-belief, confidence and improved understanding of other cultures, and are a platform from where this belief manifests. We aim to inspire creativity,  showcase and developing talent, and connect communities through discussion to challenge social norms that divide and limit societies.

Our core values are: inclusion, connection, understanding, and learning. We:

**Organise events to showcase multinational talents through dance, music, storytelling and performance arts.

**Hold talks and discussion to generate understanding and action on important social topics.

**Facilitate workshops to encourage participation in performing arts, increase skill sets and inspire confidence.

**Provide mentoring and support to creative artists to enable them to reach their highest potential.

Our Vision

A world where all people believe in their greatest potential and care for one another.

Our mission

To inspire people to believe they can and to create greater understanding and trust between cultures.

To date BE United have successfully hosted shows in the Edinburgh Fringe 2015 and 2016 and been involved in the 2014/15 Edinburgh Mela’s and hosted a 2 day festival, 4 Nations United as part of TradFest 2017. We have held cultural celebrations across Edinburgh including: Bollywood meets Brazil and Black History Month Events, and host talks and workshops over the year.

 

In South Africa BE United have hosted 4 major sporting tournaments in partnership with Orlando Pirates player Ayanda Gcaba. We provide ongoing mentoring and support to young people in Newlands West, and have financially supported Izolweze Care Centre and a community Bike Project. Our creative art activities include our Township Experience Documentary and several music events such as: Township Idols and Road to Scotland.

 

Each year our work, our team, our supporters, our passion and our skills grow with our projects, our dreams, our reach and our global impact! BE United are on a mission and this is just the beginning!

 

BE part of Inspiring Change! Join our Production! Pledge Now! BE part of something that is BEyond Borders.

 

Siyabonga &
column8:
Thanks.

 

Thanks to the organisations and people who have already supported this project: Edinburgh City Council, Scottish International Storytelling Festival(SISF), Laurie Bowman (crowd funder video maker), StormID, Lindsay Picken and Alex GagasiFM, the list is already too long to name you all! We thank each of you! <

3

We:**Organise events to showcase multinational talents through dance, music, storytelling and performance arts.**Hold talks and discussion to generate understanding and action on important social topics.**Facilitate workshops to encourage participation in performing arts, increase skill sets and inspire confidence.**Provide mentoring and support to creative artists to enable them to reach their highest potential.Our VisionA world where all people believe in their greatest potential and care for one another.Our missionTo inspire people to believe they can and to create greater understanding and trust between cultures.To date BE United have successfully hosted shows in the Edinburgh Fringe 2015 and 2016 and been involved in the 2014/15 Edinburgh Mela’s and hosted a 2 day festival, 4 Nations United as part of TradFest 2017. We have held cultural celebrations across Edinburgh including: Bollywood meets Brazil and Black History Month Events, and host talks and workshops over the year. In South Africa BE United have hosted 4 major sporting tournaments in partnership with Orlando Pirates player Ayanda Gcaba. We provide ongoing mentoring and support to young people in Newlands West, and have financially supported Izolweze Care Centre and a community Bike Project. Our creative art activities include our Township Experience Documentary and several music events such as: Township Idols and Road to Scotland. Each year our work, our team, our supporters, our passion and our skills grow with our projects, our dreams, our reach and our global impact! BE United are on a mission and this is just the beginning! BE part of Inspiring Change! Join our Production! Pledge Now! BE part of something that is BEyond Borders. Siyabonga & Thanks. Thanks to the organisations and people who have already supported this project: Edinburgh City Council, Scottish International Storytelling Festival(SISF), Laurie Bowman (crowd funder video maker), StormID, Lindsay Picken and Alex GagasiFM, the list is already too long to name you all! We thank each of you! <3",18.0,0,"1 Campaign

About The Project
My name is Thalia Gonzalez Kane and I am a queer, Ecuadorian-Canadian artist based in Toronto.
The '94 Club is my playwriting debut and the inaugural production of Crave Productions.

Based on true events, THE ’94 CLUB explores gender politics, sexuality, coming of age, queerness and the harsh realities of of growing up in a small town. As our society grows into one of openness and understanding, it is important we hear these stories of oppression and pain. It is important we acknowledge our past and work to amend the future. Without self-reflection, we will not be able to better ourselves and our world.
<h3>What We Need &amp

Putting on a new play is not easy, nor is it cheap. We need to cover space rental, rehearsal space, insurance, supplies, advertising etc.... but most importantly- The artists. We are proud to be paying every single artist involved Equity rates and that takes up the majority of our budget. This is a new play being produced by an indie theatre company. It would be easy to do the show under a profit-share model, it happens all the time. However, we have an unbelievable team of women assembled to put on this show and it was vital in planning that everyone be paid. Our budget is higher than the usual indie theatre production, but we feel good knowing our artists will have some means to continue to live their lives.
The Team

The seven-time Dora Nominee, Monica Dottor (Nightwood, Canadian Stage, Soulpepper) directs and choreographs this complex, visceral play featuring actors Tamara Almeida (Good Witch, Heroes Reborn, Warehouse 13), Jeanie Calleja (Schitt’s Creek, Reign, Murdoch Mysteries, Slings and Arrows), Shaina Silver-Baird (Citadel Theatre, 4th Line Theatre, Soulpepper), Thalia Kane (ROTC, Pea Green Theatre, Chekhov Collective) and introducing newcomer, Lily Scriven.
Other Ways You Can Help

column2: >If you can't manage to donate any funds, not to worry! Here are other ways you can help...
>Share our Facebook event or the show info link: http://www.tarragontheatre.com/show/the94club/
>Share our campaign with someone you think might want to support!
>Buy a ticket! We want to share this story with as many people as we can. We have lower rates for artsworkers and students to make it more accessible and a preview show that costs only $15!

Location: Two Roads Theater

Dates: reasons to be pretty 11/11, 11/12 &
column3:
11/20

Cast: We will be holding auditions on 9/22

 

Who We Are

My name is Lexi Graboski
column4:
I’m an actress and producer living in Los Angeles. I have a BA in Theater Arts from Loyola Marymount University. I’ve been working in front of and behind the camera for the past few years but I’m about to get back to my roots in the theater.  

I’m really excited to be teaming with Kelly Shea and her non-profit The Collective Studio: Los Angeles to bring both Reasons To Be Pretty and Reasons To Be Happy to life this fall. We also have actor/director extraordinaire Jeffrey Meek to helm the ship as the director. You may know Jeff from his work on the silver screen over the years. He is also the Artistic Director of PlayFest Santa Barbara.

There are so many amazing artists that don’t get to spread their wings in the theater in Los Angeles, and we will be very lucky to employ a handful of talented and dedicated people. For the community, putting on a play is like starting a conversation. This conversation to me is about beauty, attraction, love, self-discovery, growing up, and communication, or lack there of. Our project is unique because we will be doing a play and its sequel in two consecutive weekends – giving the audience a chance to catch up or refresh their memory of Neil LaBute’s great works before his third play in the series premieres.

As a contributor you can be proud of creating jobs for artists and helping us develop characters the audience can relate to in a therapeutic way.

 

Our Production Will Gave Back to the Community

We are all very passionate about giving back. Although we need to fundraise for the production, we are not taking a profit for ourselves. That’s why a portion of every ticket sale will be donated to the Center for Non-Violent Communication. The CNVC is a global organization that supports the learning and sharing of Nonviolent Communication (NVC), and helps people peacefully and effectively resolve conflicts in personal, organizational, and political settings. You can find out more here: https://www.cnvc.org

 

What We Need &
column5:
What You Get

To start production, we need $3,500 to:

column1: • pay to reserve our performance space
• pay for our rehearsal space
• pay for the rights to the plays
• pay the designers to begin their designs
• pay the stage manager and director

What you get: That amazing feeling that you’ve helped artists in need, some good karma, the opportunity to see TWO great plays, and of course your choice of perks on the right.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can donate and we totally understand. There are lots of other ways to show your support! You can:
<li>Share our campaign with your friends
column2: post on Facebook, send an email, or just tell your gossiping neighbor about us.

column1: • Donate your time and help us load in our set during tech week or run the concessions at one of our shows.
• Come see our shows!

""Speak the speech I pray you! ""
Or what if we don't..?
""Words, words, words""
What would happens if we take away Shakespeare’s words, like ""words"" Sound insane???
""Though this be madness, yet there is method in't.""
Prism Movement Theater is going to dive right into those questions with our avaunt- bard production of LEAR

Join Prism Movement Theater as they adapt one of Shakespeare's greatest plays, all without a single word. LEAR is a beautiful and moving work of dance theater that focuses on the relationship between Lear and her daughters. 

When Lear is betrayed by her corrupt daughters, Regan and Goneril, her sanity is sent into a tailspin, forcing her only faithful daughter, Cordelia, to take up the mantle and fight for her mother's dignity and the fate of the kingdom.
And of course we’re going to do all it without words. Just As You Like It, PMT fans.
O BRAVE NEW WORLD!

This fall, Prism Movement Theater has been given the incredible opportunity to perform in Theater Three's basement space, Theater Too.  That means you have the opportunity to help fund this incredible work of art that will be performing in the heart of uptown under the umbrella of an award-winning theater like Theater Three.  This collaboration is an amazing opportunity for us but we need your help to pull it off!

Written by Prism Movement Theater cofounder, Katy Tye, (the writer behind incredible shows like Persephone and MIDAS) This production of LEAR will heavily feature dance, clowning, live music, and sword fights, all to subvert and reinvent the classical Lear narrative into something for the modern age.

By doing wordless Shakespeare, we are diving right into the core of the emotional life in Shakespeare’s work.  From the minute the audience walks downstairs into that basement theater, we want them to feel as if they are descending into Shakespeare’s world and eventually Lear’s madness.

The audience will walk into Lear’s retirement party, where they will meet Regan, Goneril, the Fool, Cordelia, and even Lear herself. After the party goes horribly wrong, Lear struggles to maintain her sanity, and pulls the audience down with her on her slide into madness.
For more info about Theater Three, and Katy Tye’s amazing previous written work check out the links on the indiegogo page!
SO WHERE’S MY MONEY GOING?

Well other than knowing knowing that you’re supporting a female playwright, new original work, and the only wordless movement theater group in Dallas, we believe in providing real benefits to people who put their money where their mouth is and support us early.
The perks on this indiegogo are top notch, offering specialized LEAR audience experiences and valuable Prism Movement Theater classes.
If you've ever wanted to learn how to sword fight, Have dinner with Jeff and Katy, or be treated like royalty at our shows, this indiegogo is your chance to get those perks and more!
And what's great is that all of these perks and services that you buy go directly to making the show happen and paying our talent for their time and expertise.
And we're not kidding! In our most recent tax filings we found that Prism Movement Theater  gives 90% of its income to the artists who create this work!
Prism Movement Theater is not out to make money, we just want to provide a special form of theater that does not exist in Dallas.
So check out our perks! We guarantee they’re worth it!
WHEN
WHERE

2800 Routh St. 
Dallas, TX 75201
CAST AND CREW

Lear - Marianne T Galloway
Fool - Kwame David Lilly
Regan - Constance Grace Dolph
Goneril - Iv Amenti
Cordelia - Allison Morris
Writer/Choreographer - Katy Tye
Director/Fight Choreographer - Jeffrey Colangelo
Assistant Director/Choreographer - Mitchell Stephens
Assistant Choreographer - Beth Lipton
Composer - Ivan Dillard
Lighting Designer - Jonah Gutierrez

Summary

Hi! We're Laura Watkins (music and lyrics) and Nicholas David Brandt (book), the creators of ""Comic-Con The Musical."" Along with our producer/original cast member Jessica Gardner, we are so excited to finally bring our new musical to the stage.

Turns out, putting up a new musical has some costs involved. Rather than ask for your donations, we've decided to offer some VIP tickets, exclusive merch, and other goodies in exchange for your support. That's how we roll.
What Your Purchase Will Help Us Cover:
- Our fantastic theatre space, Sacred Fools Second Stage, insurance, and a stage manager
- The costs of being involved in the Hollywood Fringe Festival
- Advertisements so we can make sure we have sold out shows every night, including our poster (drawn by comic artist Scott Arnold and colored by Shaun Steven Struble)
- Rehearsal and tech space
- Playbills and printing
- Costume rental/purchases (especially for our awesome ""Masquerade"" ball number!)
- Set pieces and props
Total needed = $3500
***Producer's Note: We don't plan on making a profit. Any extra money made will be split between our amazing cast of actors! Which we would love to do!
***Second Producer's Note: If you'd like to purchase multiple items/tickets/perks, you'll have to checkout for each one individually. Sorry for the inconvenience and THANK YOU!!!!

We believe in our show. Our show is diverse, inclusive, original, and funny (at least we think it is!) It celebrates nerds of all kinds and we think it will strike a chord with a lot of people. We're going all the way with it, and this is the first step.

We don't want anything to be mediocre. We don't want to have to choose between costumes or props because of monetary restraints, or only be able to afford one tech rehearsal on the stage. If you can help by supporting us, then you are part of our journey.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help us monetarily right now, you can still help us by spreading the word.
- Have friends in the theatre/comic world? Tell them about us!
- Share our Indiegogo campaign!
- Follow us on social media and share what we share!
Thank you! And thanks for supporting the arts!

The Fantasy Party is an interactive Male Revue that is perfect for Girls-Night-Out, Bachelorette Parties and BFF Reunions. It is produced and presented by Staceyy Robinson, former lead performer of Chippendales, along with longtime Las Vegas and Off Broadway producers and its director.  This show was created a few years ago and successfully had runs in New York City at the World Famous "" China Club"" and Sofias, along with a long-term run at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Hollywood, Florida.

The Website and Social media handles that will be created for the show will highlight how much fun the show is.  It has a long history of performance and entertaining to the Girls-Night-Out crowd.

The business model is to market via social media and search engine optimization, to find and seek bachelorettes and groups seeking a unique experience. The show is flirtatious fun and also perfect for reunions and groups seeking an arousing and sexy night of Male Revue entertainment.

We are seeking funds to help relaunch, market and promote one of the most popular Off- Broadway Girls-Night-Out productions in New York City history. With the hands-on Male Revue experience of Staceyy Robinson and the support of the former producer and director from the  ""Tony n' Tina's Wedding"" productions of Las Vegas and New York, we will use the funds for marketing, advertising and setup of the launch with an incredible opening night in Las Vegas!  It then tours through great state of Texas in Houston, Dallas and Austin!

The Website will be formulated for optimal search engine optimization, along with a powerful outreach on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.  Staceyy Robinson, lead producer, is a world renowned former lead dancer for ""Chippendales"" and is using his expertise in Male Revue and interactive entertainment to launch this show.

Whether you’re planning a Bachelorette night, an after-work party, or just a night for friends to get together, The Fantasy Party is the perfect event! 

Your evening begins with cocktails (of course) and dancing. Then, get ready to meet the group of hunks.  These guys serve as your tour guides for a sexy night of fun.


The party includes exciting adult-only games (Abs for Grabs), pole-dancing lessons, up close and personal experiences, hilarious activities and everything in between as you party with our studs!  Remember, as audience members you are not just guests, you are the SHOW! 

​But be careful... whatever happens at the Fantasy Party doesn't stay at the Fantasy Party. It becomes a Girls' Night Out you and your friends will be talking about for a long, long time. Remember…we have one and only one motto - The Fantasy Party ""Where Girls Rule!""

The biggest risks involved in launching a show is audience approval and reaching the proper target audience to attend. This show is produced by three people who have over 50 years of Producing, Directing and performance under their belts.

Staceyy Robinson has been performing for 11+ years on stage for Chippendales and has a huge social media following.

Jeff Gitlin produced Tony n' Tina's Wedding in Las Vegas for 13 years, New York City for 10 years and Hawaii for 5 years, along with 2 years on Norwegian Cruise Lines and in Bermuda.

Larry Pellegrini is the original creator and director of Tony n' Tina's Wedding, which has gone on to be one of the most successfull Off-Broadway Productions in history.

The combined efforts of all three producers shall make the challenges of launching this show very successful. If anything comes up after getting funded, we will handle it like a professional team. We will evaluate the potential problem and come up with a workable solution that is in the best interests of the production.   This campaign launches with an incredible opening night in Las Vegas!  It then tours through great state of Texas in Houston, Dallas and Austin!-  Where girls rule!

If anything comes up after getting funded, we will handle it like a professional team. We will evaluate the potential problem and come up with a workable solution that is in the best interests of the production.   This campaign launches with an incredible opening night in Las Vegas!  It then tours through great state of Texas in Houston, Dallas and Austin!-  Where girls rule!",8.0,0,"1 Campaign

We will deeply appreciate your support by helping us fund the upcoming Staged Reading. Your contribution* will help underwrite expenses for our creative team consisting of director, production manager, musical director plus venue rental, production and promotional expenses. 

We are presenting a Staged Reading. The cast will perform the complete two act musical but without sets, costumes or choreography. The Staged Reading will allow us to see how the production plays to an audience. For those that would like to provide audience feedback, you are invited to stay after the performance. In the near future, we hope to perform the full length musical Story of the Century at a local or regional theater.

There will be two Staged Readings – Saturday, August 19th at 7:30pm. &
column2:
Sunday, August 20th at 3:00pm. We will perform at The Goppert Theatre-Avila University, 11901 Wornall Rd (118th Street), Kansas City, MO 64145

 If you donate to a level that receives one of the Stakeholder Certificates or DVD, those will be distributed at the Staged Readings. (If you cannot attend, please provide us with your mailing address.)

 

About the Musical

Story of the Century is an original musical about the invention of the Ezekiel Airship, a flying machine built by Burrell Cannon that flew in Pittsburg, Texas in 1902, a year before the Wright brothers’ historic flight. Was Cannon a revolutionary inventor, a visionary prophet, or a misguided dreamer?

With a mixture of historical and fictional characters, Story of the Century captures the spirit at  the turn of the 20th century as a tidal wave of cultural and technological change swept across the country. By 1902, horseless carriages were appearing and the age of manned flight was dawning. Yet, less than 40 years after the end of the Civil War, women couldn’t vote and the Women’s Christian Temperance League was already working to prohibit the use of alcohol throughout the country. In the finale, the cast in 1902 ponders the “new world so sweet and strange” that will exist 100 years in the future. All of us who are living in that world today know about the monumental changes that have occurred in the 115 years since 1902. We also know that some things haven’t changed.

About the Ezekiel Airship

Burrell (Burl) Cannon was a college educated engineer who operated a sawmill near Pittsburg, Texas in 1902. He was also an ordained Baptist minister and an accomplished inventor. Burl had a vision in which God’s plan for a flying machine was revealed. He and Paul Thorsell, owner of the Pittsburg Foundry, along with other investors organized the Ezekiel Airship Manufacturing Company, Inc. and sold stock at $25 to build the Ezekiel Airship.

About the Author

I was born and reared in Texas, but my family and I have lived in Prairie Village, Kansas for over thirty years. I first learned about the Ezekiel Airship about 25 years ago when our family visited Greenville, Texas, the home of my brother, Ted Hill and his wife Maggie. Ted told me about the full scale model of the Ezekiel Airship then on display in the Warrick Restaurant in Pittsburg, Texas. We drove there the next day and the story of the Ezekiel Airship has been a part of me ever since. (The full scale replica of the Ezekiel Airship is now displayed at the Northeast Texas Rural Heritage Museum in Pittsburg, Texas.) 

After the idea of a play about the Airship had begun to form in my mind, I asked Ted, an aeronautical engineer, to build a small scale model of the Ezekiel Airship. Ted’s model reflects his expert ability to build anything made of wood. However, his model of the Airship is too precious to be used as a stage prop, so the onstage model was built by my daughter, Erin Hill.

I first put pen to paper for Story of the Century 20 years ago but didn’t start working seriously until 2012 when I began collaborating with musician Sarah Hill. The development of the musical accelerated once we learned it had been accepted for the 2016 Kansas City Fringe Festival. Since then I have expanded my collaboration to include Director Dr. Chris McCoy, Production Manager Marybeth Sorrell, and Music Director Brant Challacombe.

*Contributions to this campaign will go to Story of the Century, LLC. and are not tax deductible.

The cost of bringing a show to the Fringe is a huge challenge for most theatre companies but for those of us who come from working class and/or BAME backgrounds, that mountain can be even steeper to climb. However, we truly believe in the importance of this show, the relevance and poignancy of the script and the talent of our director and performers. Showcasing this kind of work is not only crucial to creating a more diverse and representative Fringe Festival but also to ensuring that the UK is adequately reflected across the theatre industry as a whole.

 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Taking an ethnically and socio-economically diverse team to Edinburgh is hugely exciting and subversive but the biggest pitfall of that goal is that working class actors and often BAME actors can't afford to work for free. With this in mind, we are hoping to pay them each a very small fee, just so they can survive while we are doing our 24 show run at the Fringe.

Larger donations would see you truly investing in the future of this show. However, small contributions really do add up. The equivalent of what you might spend on a round of drinks on a night out could help pay for one of our actors costumes. And instead of a horrible hangover the next day, you'll be left with that warm fuzzy feeling that contributing to something good can often leave you with. 

 

About the play...

There are a great many laughs in this play but, embedded in Rupture's intricate narrative, there are also some serious questions about how the decisions we make now could effect us in the future.

It tells the story of Jay Sharma, who has just started his dream job at a mysterious government agency. The year is 2107 and the planet has barely managed to rebuild itself after being brought to its knees by a catastrophic global event. It is in this broken world that Jay finds himself faced with a terrible decision and soon discovers his dream job has a dark side...

 

The Impact

Your contribution will really make a difference. Not just to us. Not even just to theatre and the arts as a whole. But also to a wonderful charity called Arts Emergency. 10% of all ticket profits will be going straight to this wonderful organisation who help young people from low income backgrounds gain access to the arts and humanities and forge careers in the creative industries. We'll be using the profits of this show to help pave the way for some of the BAME and working class theatremakers of the future, so the more successful it is, the bigger an impact we can have.

The play itself explores climate change and the consequences of bureaucracy in an unflinching yet accessible way that is sure to make audiences think and is intended to create a dialogue on the subjects. Rupture's unwavering look at the future of the world may even be a little controversial but we believe that healthy debate is more vital than ever in today's society and we look forward to having the opportunity to be a part of that conversation.

","Short Summary
CK Productions Inc. is a successful Long Island & Manhattan based production company and we need your help!

Producing over 25 theatrical productions a year, CK Theatricals works with Children as young as 4 years old and professional adults to create live theatre, original work & amateur theatre affordable and fun for the surrounding communities.

Our award-winning Films & Visual Media have created some major buzz online and in recent Film Festivals over the years. CK Productions strives to continue its tradition of the 18 & under branch where children 18 & under can learn how to create film & visual media in the Creation of Film & Theatre Classes offer at our Studio.

With your help, we will be able to keep making silly videos like the one above, legit films, inspiring theatre and ways to give back to our youth! Your contribution, no matter the price, will be a help for many people.
What We Need & What You Get
We need as much money as we can get! #CKNeedsYourMoney is just as real as any other Hashtag, but with your help and word of mouth, we can seriously fund some incredible projects.

Our Goal of $10,000+ (which will be split evenly amongst the four CK branches) can be accomplished simply by your interest in these fantastic perks including Season Passes, DVD copies of past CK Theatricals shows or CK Films, producer credits & more!
If we do not reach our goal, our funds will still be evenly split amongst the four branches!
The Impact
Your contribution will impact the lives of many children whom are involved in CK Productions - Ronkonkoma Classes & Productions and other volunteers whom are so passionate in CK succeed.

CK Productions has had 5 campaigns in its history (primarily for CK Films specific projects). All of our money raised has gone 100% towards making our projects not only professional, but customized to what YOU, the audience member and proud supporter wants to see.
Risks & Challenges
Oh trust us! While our objective is set, the hurdle to accomplish that objective is a large one!
We know that there are hundreds of the same campaigns so getting visibility will not only be a challenge, but a huge responsibility for our team.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Make some noise about our campaign! Share our Hashtag along with our link to the campaign using Hashtag #CKneedsyourmoney!
Remember you can use Indiegogo's incredible share tools to share on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram & more!
Don't forget to stay connected with us online at www.ckproductionsnewyork.com or on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram!

And that's all there is to it. If you aren't convinced... contact us at info@ckproductionsnewyork.com. We'd love to convince you! Thank you for your contribution, your share and your support!",0.0,0,"4 Campaigns

We are very excited to bring to life a new Chicago musical, BURNHAM'S DREAM: THE WHITE CITY. To accomplish this goal, we need your help! Ever dream of being a Broadway producer? Well, now is your chance to get in on the ground floor of an incredible theatrical experience! We need to raise $40,000 by the end of the year in order to launch our production. All donations are tax-deductible*!  Are you in?

BURNHAM'S DREAM is a smart, topical, toe-tapping, thought-provoking look into the 1893 World’s Fair and its players. Be a part of history by bringing this bit of history to today's audiences!

Why a musical about Dan Burnham and the 1893 World’s Fair 125 years later? Because it was a “tipping point” for the City -- a transition from the Victorian  Gilded Age of the 1890s to the 20th Century, and the development of civic pride and concern for the quality of life for all Chicagoans.

Imagine being able to build a new city on more than 600 acres of lakefront in Chicago. Imagine being in charge of the design and construction of that city of the future.

Daniel Burnham’s name is known by a wide public, thanks to his 1909 Plan of Chicago, not to mention Erik Larson’s book, The Devil in the White City, soon to be a motion picture.

Burnham’s personal life -- his challenges, his ambition, his sacrifices -- are the focus of the new musical, Burnham’s Dream: The White City. The man himself is revealed in his words and actions as he confronts the difficulties posed by women, minorities, construction deadlines, and Louis Sullivan.

BURNHAM'S DREAM: THE WHITE CITY has been officially endorsed by Illinois Bicentennial and is live on our website here:
column2:

About Us

Writer and producer JUNE FINFER is president of Lost and Found Productions.   Her play about Mies van der Rohe’s Farnsworth House, The Glass House, premiered in New York City in 2010.  Developmental presentations of Burnham’s Dream: The White City were  presented in Chicago venues to enthusiastic capacity audiences at IIT, Glessner House, Athenaeum Theater, Pleasant Home, Swedenborg Library at the  Chicago Temple,  CliffDwellers, and Heitman Architects.   https://lostandfoundproductions.org/

Award-winning ASCAP member  ELIZABETH DOYLE  is the composer and co-lyricist of Burnham’s Dream.   She has worked with June Finfer to develop the musical over several years of concert performances.  Doyle’s solo cabaret and jazz programs have wowed live and broadcast audiences and she has composed music for many musicals produced in the Midwest and California, including  Fat Tuesday, The Virginian, and Sleepy Hollow.  www.elizabethdoylemusic.com

 

Lost and Found Productions, founded by June Finfer in 1993, has produced award-winning films about art and architecture that are in international distribution,  including The Farnsworth House, Mies van der Rohe’s Czech Masterpiece: Tugendhat House, Creating Community: Lafayette Park, and the Chicago Parks of Alfred Caldwell.  
 

Finfer’s interest in architecture and urban planning was a result of her marriage to the late architect and city and regional planner Paul Finfer, designer of the New Town of Valdez, Alaska,  after the Good Friday Earthquake.  He was always aware of the impact of  their physical setting on the daily lives of people --  access to open spaces,  safe transportation routes, accommodation to nature’s imperatives.  Fascinated by the vision and idealism of her husband, and the challenges he faced in dealing with the political and economic pressures on any planning project, June Finfer explored in films and plays the lives and accomplishments of visionaries such as Mies van der Rohe, John Root, Louis Sullivan,  and Daniel Burnham. 

Testimonial From A Concert Performance
""The White City Musical - - With the combination of history, humor and excellent musical performances, the show appealed to a wide audience including seniors, young adults, music aficionados and architecture buffs.  Guests particularly enjoyed the representation of Daniel Burnham and Louis Sullivan, and music numbers such as ""Never Marry an Architect"" and ""Are You In"" were crowd favorites. If The White City Musical were to become a full production, there will already be a solid fan base who will jump at the chance to experience it again."" 

Heidi Ruehle-May, Execotive Director, Pleasant Home, Oak Park, Il


Review of The Glass House production in NYC 

Fascinating.  It’s a great approach to illuminating and humanizing the lives of people we have come to regard, wrongly, as icons rather than people. 

Jon Camea, Director , The Working Group, NY

WOMEN'S SHOWCASE 2017:
LadyFestCLT is excited to present our third annual Women's Showcase, this January at the Charlotte Ballet.  Gathering for an evening of sharing, we aim to create a space that celebrates the accomplishments of female artists, specifically movement makers.  This festival will showcase performances by female choreographers and performance artists.

The festival  strengthens the performing arts community in Charlotte by bringing artists together and creating a dialogue between the audience and performers concerning work that is being made through the female lens.
With your contribution, we are inviting you to be a part of this festival!

What We Need:
Our costs to bring this festival to the community include:

space rental
    theatre staff
    advertisement
    stipends for traveling artists
    payment to videographers/photographers
In return, you the contributor will get recognized as a supporter of the festival, PLUS we have some awesome perks for Lady Fest VIPs!

Mission:
Women's Showcase seeks to draw the public’s eye to the important work of female artists by facilitating a cross-disciplinary festival that features the women leaders of our arts community.

Challenges:
Though female dancers and female choreographers may out number male dancers/choreographers, we have found from personal experience elsewhere and  in Charlotte, that men receive the majority of the awards, grants, support, opportunities, leadership roles and recognition.

While we do not aim to discredit or exclude the accomplishments of our male partners, we desire to draw attention to the voices of the women in our field and give them the opportunity to share their own stories.

Other Ways You Can Help:
Come see the show! We would appreciate your support and would love to see you there. If you want to see more festivals like this happen, share this page with your friends!

","WOMEN'S SHOWCASE 2017:LadyFestCLT is excited to present our third annual Women's Showcase, this January at the Charlotte Ballet.  Gathering for an evening of sharing, we aim to create a space that celebrates the accomplishments of female artists, specifically movement makers.  This festival will showcase performances by female choreographers and performance artists.

The festival  strengthens the performing arts community in Charlotte by bringing artists together and creating a dialogue between the audience and performers concerning work that is being made through the female lens.
With your contribution, we are inviting you to be a part of this festival!
What We Need:Our costs to bring this festival to the community include:
space rental    theatre staff    advertisement    stipends for traveling artists    payment to videographers/photographers
In return, you the contributor will get recognized as a supporter of the festival, PLUS we have some awesome perks for Lady Fest VIPs!

Short Summary

The Voyeur Theatre Collective (VTC) has been busy making art for the past three years, with a new show released annually. This year, we have been given the great honor of debuting our show NEXT LEVEL, at the George Town Festival in Penang, Malaysia. VTC has the opportunity to showcase our unique art form to a global audience.
What We Need

We need your help! Although we were accepted to the festival, the cost of getting the collective to Malaysia, and staging a full-scale production requires funds. Patrons of art will not want to miss this opportunity to be at the ground stage of this revolutionary project.

Our current goal of $4,000 will go toward the price of producing a show at the George Town Festival. Our budget includes sound equipment, light equipment, set costs, and travel costs. This is our largest show to date, and anything you give will help.
<ul>
• With a donation of $20 the donor will get a patron credit for our show in Malaysia
• With a donation of $100 we will showcase any link to a website, Instagram, or other media on our page
• With a donation of $200 dollars, the cast of the Malaysian show will sign a program and mail it to your door. Don't miss this opportunity for a one-of-a-kind keepsake.

• With a donation of $500 the donor will have an opportunity to be featured as a patron and will be able to include a photo and bio in the shows program. Don't miss this opportunity to be a part of the show!
• With a donation of $2000 you will have the credit of an Executive Producer. This credit is extremely valuable and will give you full access to the Voyeur Theatre Collective.
The Impact

With our show in Malaysia we look to do more than provide entertainment, we will be sharing our method with other artists in Malaysia. Through partnerships with local artists and schools, we will be sharing our methodology and ideology with locals. With your funding, our mission of making theatre approachable to a new generation can be reached globally.
<h3>Risks &amp

Creating a cross cultural, global theatre experience is no easy feat. We recognize the host of challenges that confront us, such as, cultural application, space adaptation, and a short-timeline. All of these challenges makes your donation even more valuable! We need your help in achieving this amazing opportunity.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the position to give, we understand, but there are many other ways to help us reach our goal. First and foremost is to get the word out. Please share this campaign on any social media platform. Every share results in more people donating to the cause. If you are aware of any contacts or possible avenues, please do not be afraid to reach out! We are always looking to collaborate.

Previous Shows

Our first production, ENTRAINMENT (2015), took place in a warehouse in downtown Chicago. The evening was divided into three parts: first, an art gallery featuring original installations from over 15 local chicago artists. Next, a devised live performance piece featuring an ensemble of 7 actors. The performance took place in a “performance cube” at the center of the warehouse. The cube was sectioned off by four floor-to-ceiling screens that we projected original film content onto. The final part of the evening was a live-DJ set and after party featuring more original sound and video content.

Last year, we mounted about:blank (2016), a site-specific piece set in a run-down college apartment. Using a multi-roomed space with scenes occurring on a loop, our audience encountered a “choose your own adventure” experience, voyeuristically following whatever characters they pleased as they navigated the party. About:blank featured the original work of 5 musical composers and marked our shift into “loop-based” storytelling.

Links to the ENTRAINMENT and about:blank archive, our website, and clips from prior shows are below:

https://www.entrainmentarchive.com/

https://www.meetmeatthespace.tumblr.com/

http://www.voyeurtheatre.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aAP48OG0itU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EiJgzMGVxmo

Seeking love and
enlightenment in the era of Yelp
We are seeking your
support for the world premiere of this freshly written musical comedy featuring 10
original songs and four female leads that opens in San Diego on November 6<sup>th</sup>. The book, music
and lyrics for The 3 ½ Star Musical was written by a talented team of writers, musicians and improvisers.
ABOUT THE SHOW:
INSPIRATION
The show was inspired
by one of the writer’s own personal experience with Yelp. While Yelp can be a
useful tool for consumers, it can also be used by the ill-intentioned to wage a
campaign against a business owner.
SYNOPSIS
Former Wall Street executive
Megan Stamp and her Buddhist vegan lover Willow Branch leave Manhattan and
technology behind for a second chance at love – moving to a small town where
they open a vegan café. All is well until lonely, power hungry Sybil Grim comes
into the café, hates everything they represent and writes a scathing Yelp
review. When Evie, the seductive Yelp sales girl, the Yelpbots and the Yelp
Elite come onto the scene,  Megan is
lured into an online battle that threatens to destroy her relationship with
Willow and their business.
THEME
The 3 ½ Star Musical
is fun musical romp with a tender love story at its core. It is about finding
love and enlightenment, the struggle to be present and live in the moment
rather than consumed by technology and about the impact online sites like Yelp
have on small businesses.
DIVERSITY
We are proud of the
fact this show features four female lead roles and a lesbian love story as its
central theme.  The 3 1/2 Star Musical celebrates diversity.
CREATIVE TEAM &
CAST
DIRECTOR: MICHAEL SCHWARTZ: Michael’s favorite
directing credits include WAITING FOR GODOT at Portland Stage Company and UBU
ROCK--a musical adaptation of the classic French play--at the Mandell Weiss
Theater. He is also extremely proud of the time he spent with the national tour of RENT and the work he
did for Barry Manilow's never-made-it-to-Broadway-musical HARMONY. Michael has worked
extensively in educational theater with the International Schools Theatre
Association--teaching physical comedy workshops around the world. He holds a
certificate in commedia dell'arte from the Dell 'Arte Players in Blue Lake and
an MFA in directing from UC San Diego where he remains a visiting instructor.
JOE HUPPERT, MUSIC AND LYRICS,
MUSICAL DIRECTOR: Joe's
previous composition credits include the musicals <i>The Angles of Angst
(Chicago, Edinburgh) and The Eight Hours (Chicago). He has composed
scores for multiple short films and dozens of plays including <i>Milvotchkee,Visconsin
(M'Olelo)
column2: Unnecessary Farce, The Fox on the Fairway, Angel Street, The

column1: Elephant Man, Fools (Peninsula Players), Over the Tavern, King O' The Moon
(Mercury), Rumors, The Last Seder, Bedroom Farce (Organic). Joe also served
as music director for Second City in Chicago from 1989 to 1997. Joe is Sound
and Video Master for La Jolla Playhouse, working with Broadway creatives on new
plays and musicals such as <i>Peter and the Starcatchers, Hunchback, Yoshimi,
Hands on a Hardbody etc.
SIMON POND, BOOK AND LYRICS: Simon has been
performing improv and sketch comedy for over a decade. His sketch troupe Jape
was nominated for a Canadian Comedy Award for the best sketch group in the
country. He has also worked for Second City Theatricals on Norwegian Cruise
Lines. Recent directing credits include the Finest City Improv sketch review
Thawed.
KEVIN AND NANCY LANGDON, MUSIC
AND LYRICS, MUSICAL DIRECTOR: Kevin
and Nancy Langdon are musicians, singer-songwriters and improvisers. They have
written and performed their original songs together for 20 years. Both Kevin
and Nancy have studied and performed improv at Finest City Improv, Sidestage
Improv and National Comedy Theater. Their music has been featured locally on
KPRI and KNSJ and their band Crywolf was recently the ""SoCal Featured
Artist of the Week"" on Listen Local Radio. The Langdons perform regularly
at local San Diego venues including the House of Blues.
KARA CAMDEN, MUSIC AND LYRICS: Kara creates theater, film and new media that uplifts through laughter
and love. Kara got her start in theater, then ventured into film acting, producing
and writing along with running her business, Itsy Bitsy Writers. She attended
UCLA’s School of Theater, Film and Television.
JIM TAYLOR, LYRICS AND STAGE
MANAGER: After a long business career and
a number of adventures such as Navy submarine service, corporate America and
life as an entrepreneur and executive coach, Jim has finally come full circle
in exercising his patiently waiting right brain. A twenty-two year veteran Toastmaster,
Jim is now a TEDx Speaker Coach.  He is also
the author of the novel “Pacing the Cage” and the anthology “Letters From Over
Yonder” and the Director of a new play, “The Third Date” in the 2015 North Park
Playwright Festival.
PEGGY WALKUSH, CONCEPT, BOOK AND
LYRICS:  Peggy Walkush is an improviser, teacher and ensemble member at Finest City Improv. She produced The Boob Show, a comedy
fundraiser to fight breast cancer, and The Big Gay Improv Show. She enjoys writing,
producing and directing sketch comedy, short films and now musicals!
ACTORS
·
LISA
RITZ – Megan Stamp
·
KIRA
BOUNDS – Willow Branch
·  CLAUDETTE SANTIAGO - Evie the Yelp Sales Girl
·  NANCY LANGDON - Sybil Grim
·  BRENT ROBERTS - Mayor, Yelp CEO, Yelpbot
·  DOUG HENDERSON - Yelp Elite Leader, Yelpbot, Townsperson
·  JOYCE DEJESUS - Yelp Elite Member, Yelpbot, Townsperson
·  VICTORIA RODRIGUEZ - Yelp Elite Member, Yelpbot, Townsperson
PRODUCTION TEAM
·  MICHAEL SCHWARTZ – Director
·  PEGGY WALKUSH – Assistant Director, Producer
·

JOE HUPPERT - Musical Director, Keyboard

·  KEVIN LANGDON - Musical Director, Guitar
·
JIM TAYLOR – Stage Manager
·
JORDAN LIBERMAN – Keyboard
·

TRACY MCDOWELL – Costume Designer

·  LISA RITZ – Choreographer

·  ZACH KREINBRINK – Tech
WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES
Funds raised through our
Indiegogo campaign will help fund the modest costs of our first run and allow
us to provide a small stipend to the cast, musicians and director of $250 per
person. We do no receive any ticket proceeds. We estimate over 700 person hours of rehearsal will have been completed
by opening night. The writers are not seeking any compensation.  If we raise more than our budget, additional funds will go to increase the stipends. <b>Our budget of
$3,695 we plan to raise includes:
·  Marketing and
promotion (postcards, social media, logo, programs, etc)  - $450
·  Costumes and props -
·  Snacks for rehearsals
(our cast are hungry beasts!) - $175
·  Stipend for actors,
musicians and the director ($250 per person) -
* We are not a non-profit so your

donation is not a charitable deduction.

TICKETS

Come to our show at Finest City Improv! Tickets are $10 (we do not receive any ticket proceeds) and available at:  http://www.finestcityimprov.com/theater/starmus...
THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR
HEARTS FOR YOUR SUPPORT! PLEASE HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!
