column2: >We are Erin's Fiddle, from Belgrade, Serbia, the biggest Irish dance school and troupe in our region. During the 10 years of existence we have overcome many problems and managed to stay together and become what we are today. Erin’s Fiddle was the first dance troupe in the region to become the member of dance association An Coimisiún le Rincí Gaelacha (CLRG), the oldest and biggest association of Irish dancers and Irish dance teachers. The membership in this association binds the troupe to teach Irish dance in a traditional way, and it also gives it an opportunity to compete in many international competitions, as well as to qualify for European and World championships.

>We are the first to have an official Irish dance instructor who has passed the assessment and gained the title of the ""Conditional Teacher"" in Ireland. She is currently working hard preparing for the final exam which will make us a permanent member of this association.

>We have performed in the biggest halls in Serbia. We are the first school from our region to have participants in European championship. We have attended 10 competitions all over Europe. We have practiced dancing in all sorts of conditions and we don't like to complain about it - it made us stronger!

>One of the most important parts of our work and determination are children. We are all familiar with the fact that most of children nowadays are not intereseted in sprots and culture in our country. We are trying to fight this by providing them with wonderful environment, great role models in their older fellow dancers, teaching them patience and spreading love for dancing, acting and team work. We are so proud of our kids and we are happy to help them find their way in life.

>During the last two years, we were determined to take a new step and we managed to make our own dancing studio. It is modest and nice. Even though we finally found our place, it has never been really finished and used to its fullest potential. We still need a proper bathroom with a shower, new windows and doors and dance floor.

>Everything we do, we do on our own and with the help of our friends. We make our own costumes, organize the shows, deal with the marketing world, learn new steps every day etc. Our teachers are choreographers as well, practically doing their job voluntarily. Each year we deliver innovative and spectacular shows which push the boundaries of Irish dance performance in our region. Our troupe counts around 80 dancers, children and adults, and around 20 dancers that are advanced professional performers competing and performing regularly.
>Erin's Fiddle was made out of love for dancing and great companionship and it grows on that to this day. Unfortunately, some things are depending on money and there is not much we can do about that.
>Since we can barely cover all costs and bills every month, any kind of renovating on our own is not in the near future. This is where you come in. We are thankful for any kind of help!

column1: How Can I Help?

column2: >To help us make better environment and conditions for dancing and practicing you can help by donating. Our campaign goal is $7.000, which will cover repairs that include: bathroom renovating, changing very old windows and doors and buying a better dance floor. Donations in any amount are critical in helping us make our studio better, so that we can continue doing what we do best.

column1: Thank You!

If we do this, we are going to have much safer, warmer and more comfortable environment for dancing. If you go through the gallery you will see how old the windows and the bathroom are. No need to explain why we have to do something about that. And for the floor.. We have some improvisation of what it should be but we keep tearing it and it just falls apart slowly since we are mostly step dancing. We really need a more durable floor, it's a matter of safety.
This studio is our second home! We are excited to make these much-needed repairs and upgrades a reality, and we are grateful for your generosity.
To find out more about us, check our website: www.erinsfiddle.com
facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/erinsfiddle
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/erinsfiddle/
twitter: https://twitter.com/ErinsFiddle
youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/nikokaojabg

","We are Erin's Fiddle, from Belgrade, Serbia, the biggest Irish dance school and troupe in our region. During the 10 years of existence we have overcome many problems and managed to stay together and become what we are today. Erin’s Fiddle was the first dance troupe in the region to become the member of dance association An Coimisiún le Rincí Gaelacha (CLRG), the oldest and biggest association of Irish dancers and Irish dance teachers. The membership in this association binds the troupe to teach Irish dance in a traditional way, and it also gives it an opportunity to compete in many international competitions, as well as to qualify for European and World championships.

We are the first to have an official Irish dance instructor who has passed the assessment and gained the title of the ""Conditional Teacher"" in Ireland. She is currently working hard preparing for the final exam which will make us a permanent member of this association.

We have performed in the biggest halls in Serbia. We are the first school from our region to have participants in European championship. We have attended 10 competitions all over Europe. We have practiced dancing in all sorts of conditions and we don't like to complain about it - it made us stronger!

One of the most important parts of our work and determination are children. We are all familiar with the fact that most of children nowadays are not intereseted in sprots and culture in our country. We are trying to fight this by providing them with wonderful environment, great role models in their older fellow dancers, teaching them patience and spreading love for dancing, acting and team work. We are so proud of our kids and we are happy to help them find their way in life.

During the last two years, we were determined to take a new step and we managed to make our own dancing studio. It is modest and nice. Even though we finally found our place, it has never been really finished and used to its fullest potential. We still need a proper bathroom with a shower, new windows and doors and dance floor.

Everything we do, we do on our own and with the help of our friends. We make our own costumes, organize the shows, deal with the marketing world, learn new steps every day etc. Our teachers are choreographers as well, practically doing their job voluntarily. Each year we deliver innovative and spectacular shows which push the boundaries of Irish dance performance in our region. Our troupe counts around 80 dancers, children and adults, and around 20 dancers that are advanced professional performers competing and performing regularly.
Erin's Fiddle was made out of love for dancing and great companionship and it grows on that to this day. Unfortunately, some things are depending on money and there is not much we can do about that.
Since we can barely cover all costs and bills every month, any kind of renovating on our own is not in the near future. This is where you come in. We are thankful for any kind of help!
How Can I Help?

To help us make better environment and conditions for dancing and practicing you can help by donating. Our campaign goal is $7.000, which will cover repairs that include: bathroom renovating, changing very old windows and doors and buying a better dance floor. Donations in any amount are critical in helping us make our studio better, so that we can continue doing what we do best.
Thank You!

If we do this, we are going to have much safer, warmer and more comfortable environment for dancing. If you go through the gallery you will see how old the windows and the bathroom are. No need to explain why we have to do something about that. And for the floor.. We have some improvisation of what it should be but we keep tearing it and it just falls apart slowly since we are mostly step dancing. We really need a more durable floor, it's a matter of safety.
This studio is our second home! We are excited to make these much-needed repairs and upgrades a reality, and we are grateful for your generosity.
To find out more about us, check our website: www.erinsfiddle.com

About Robin Hood and Playset Theatre

Robin Hood is the latest show from the theater troupe Playset Theatre.

Playset Theatre is a group of high school students who decided to start putting on shows by ourselves. Many of us have had extensive theatrical experience both through school and with professional companies, but we want to fulfill our personal artistic visions to an extent only possible when working
column4:
>independently. So we got the best and brightest theater kids we could find and put them to work creating amazing shows. We're entirely student-run, meaning everything from writing to directing to acting to fundraising to marketing has and will be done by trained and talented students.


This year, we're putting on our production of the show Robin Hood: a classic tale of honor, heroism, and treachery. The show tells the story of the charismatic outlaw Robin Hood as he fights the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham with his band of Merry Men, helps the impoverished people of Nottingham, and woos the beautiful Lady Marian. Little does he know, things are not quite as they seem...

What We Need

column1: UPDATE: Through your generosity and our other fundraising programs, we've fully funded this year's show!
As a result, we're repurposing this campaign to raise money to ensure we can continue, and expand, our company activities into next year and further!

Playset Theatre's productions are currently completely free to attend and we would like to keep it that way. But as students, we lack the funds to put this production on by ourselves. We're asking for $1,000 to pay for all the expenses associated with putting on a theatrical production. These include
<ul>
• Costumes
• Props: water-based weaponry, stuffed animals, Robin Hood doll, etc.
• Publicity: website, shirts, flyers, etc.
• Snacks/Water/All the stuff actors want at rehearsal
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 24px
<ul>
<li>

$10 USD - PIECE OF EIGHT: Get a Pin
You'll receive an official ""Playset Theatre"" button featuring our logo. Wear it with pride. Free Shipping within the US.
<li>

$25 USD - SILVER PIECE: Video Thank You
You will get a personalized video thank you (emailed to you) from one of our production members, along with a button. We'll also reserve a chair at one of our performances. Free Shipping within the US.
<li>

$40 USD - GOLD PIECE: Video Social Media Shout-Out
You will get a personalized video thank you posted to our Facebook page so all our fans can see how awesome you are. Also includes the ""Silver Piece"" perks. Free Shipping within the US.
<li>

$50 USD - TREASURE PURSE: Singing Thank You
We will post a video of one of our company members singing a personalized thank you to our Facebook page. Don't worry, we'll make sure it's one of the ones who can sing well. Also includes the ""Silver Piece"" perks. Free Shipping within the US.
<li>

$65 USD - LAMB: Pie the Director
We'll post a personalized video of us smacking a pie in the face of our director and thanking you to our Facebook page for all to see. Also includes the ""Treasure Purse"" perks. Free Shipping within the US.
<li>

$100 USD - SHEEP: Campaign T-shirt
You'll receive the exclusive campaign t-shirt for ""Robin Hood'"" and the ""Lamb"" perks with an additional reserved chair. Free Shipping within the US.
<li>

$150 USD - TREASURE CHEST: Pie Anyone
We'll send you a list of our full company and you'll get to choose one to get pied in a video thanking you, which will be posted to Facebook. Also includes the ""Treasure Purse"" perks with a shirt. Free Shipping within the US. Subject to agreement of the subject of pieing.
<li>

$250 USD - CASTLE: Everything
We'll post a personalized video of us smacking a pie in the face in our director and another company member of your choice while singing a thank you to our Facebook page. The video will also be posted permanently on our website where you will be listed a producer of Robin Hood. As producer, you'll have input into which play we put on next year. You'll also receive two shirts, two buttons, and we'll reserve four chairs. Free Shipping within the US.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a monetary donation, we would greatly appreciate if you would help get the word out on social media and tell everyone you know.

column2: >HEWMAN’s third evening-length performance installation, THIS IS NOTHING WITHOUT YOU, is our response to the question, “How do we make the audience as necessary to the performance as the performers themselves?”

>HEWMAN’s cofounders began with an experiment to choreograph independently of one another, each exploring what is private versus public within performance. We then entrusted theater director Jordan Geiger with the task of filtering our individual compositions through his non-dance eye, and arranging them into one coherent whole. His process became an investigation of how the presence of outside perspectives changes the way we see ourselves and others. After a yearlong collaboration, the result is a play on perspective and persona that is constructed the same way you will experience it - from the outside looking in. It's not enough to be there, you must also see and be seen. How is up to you.

>We are excited and grateful to ask for your help.

column1: ","What is THIS IS NOTHING WITHOUT YOU?

HEWMAN’s third evening-length performance installation, THIS IS NOTHING WITHOUT YOU, is our response to the question, “How do we make the audience as necessary to the performance as the performers themselves?”

HEWMAN’s cofounders began with an experiment to choreograph independently of one another, each exploring what is private versus public within performance. We then entrusted theater director Jordan Geiger with the task of filtering our individual compositions through his non-dance eye, and arranging them into one coherent whole. His process became an investigation of how the presence of outside perspectives changes the way we see ourselves and others. After a yearlong collaboration, the result is a play on perspective and persona that is constructed the same way you will experience it - from the outside looking in. It's not enough to be there, you must also see and be seen. How is up to you.
Why you?

We are constructing a piece around you, about you, for you. In our current cultural climate, art relies on the support of the community for whom it is made. We hope you will trust that an investment in HEWMAN is an investment in yourself, in your community, in your culture.
We are excited and grateful to ask for your help.
PRODUCTION TIMELINE
August 2015: The process launched.
August 2015 - March 2016: Choreographers Jason, Lindsay, and Ingrid each created an independent duet with solitude, intimacy, and playfulness on our minds.
April 2016: We invited theater
director Jordan Geiger into the studio to begin splicing all the pieces into one.
May 2016: Percussionist and
rocker Andrew Funcheon started composing an original score which he will
perform live.
July 2016: The process will
coalesce at a week-long residency hosted by Dance Initiative in
Carbondale, Colorado.
August 2016: After a year in
process, THIS IS NOTHING WITHOUT YOU  will premiere over two nights
at LightSpace Studios, a 5,100 square-foot, multi-level photography and video studio in Bushwick, NYC.
PRODUCTION EXPENSES
$14,208 covers the following costs of producing new work:
Collaborator Fees (for rehearsal and performance) - $8,602
Rehearsal Space Rental - $1610
Set Design and Materials - $1000
Production Personnel (Stage Manager, Videographer, etc.) - $950
Costume Materials and Design - $950
Admin and Marketing - $596
Set and Instrument Transportation - $500
When and where?
August 5th-6th at 8pmLightSpace Studios Bushwick, NYC
What is HEWMAN?

HEWMAN is an artists' collective founded by three Juilliard alumni in 2014. Through collaborative processes that pair dance with other art forms, HEWMAN creates performance installations for nontraditional venues where dance has never been before.
You can find out more about HEWMAN and our past projects at www.hewmancollective.com.
Who are the HEWMANs?
CofoundersJASON COLLINS Choreographer, PerformerJAMES LINDSAY HARWELL Choreographer, PerformerINGRID KAPTEYN Choreographer, Performer
CollaboratorsJORDAN GEIGER Theater DirectorANDREW FUNCHEON Composer, PercussionistVICTORIA BEK PerformerCAITLIN TAYLOR Performer
Production TeamVICTORIA BEK Costume DesignerJOANNA DEFELICE Set DesignerJAKE SANER Filmmaker
What else?
BUY YOUR TICKETS NOW!
Whether or not you can make a donation, please support us by spreading the word!
FACEBOOK | INSTAGRAM | TWITTER
Sponsored by

HEWMAN is a sponsored artist with The Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for HEWMAN are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: 212-691-6969 or for our national charities registration. A copy of our latest financial report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

The Final Push

More than 150 of you have helped us to raise nearly $20,000 to help bring the all-Colorado production of the play ""Waiting for Obama"" to the 20th annual New York International Fringe Festival in August 2016. Please help now as we push to raise the final $5,000 to make the project break even.

Plot Summary

John Moore has championed Colorado
theatre for 15 years as a dedicated arts journalist. He founded the
Denver Actors Fund and has raised more than $117,000 to help local
artists in need. Now he has written a topical, full-length play called that has been selected from among 1,200 entries to
be featured at NYC Fringe Festival.
But first, it will be previewed at the Buntport Theater in Denver and at
the Bas Bleu Theatre in Fort Collins so local audiences and donors can see it in process on
its way to New York. Let's help John put your money where his mouth has
been since 2001. Your donation will help:
• Build an all-Colorado production that will be showcased with five performances in New York City.
• Provide gainful employment for seven Colorado actors, a stage manager and director, as well as creative team raging from Scenic Designer to Light Designer to Stage Manager.
<li>Showcase
the talents of Colorado artists at one of the most prestigious theatre
festivals in America. This is something we can all take ownership and
pride in.
So what is this play about?
<ul><ul>
• In
""Waiting for Obama,"" one Colorado family is convinced the
President is coming for their guns. And in this town, they might be right.
• While
propelled by one of the most divisive issues of our time, ""Waiting
for Obama"" is the story of a recognizable family that, like many
others, is deeply divided by polarizing
political beliefs.
• The
director of ""Waiting for Obama"" is  Brian Freeland, who
carried the torch for avant garde theatre in Denver for 20 years with his

LIDA Project Theatre. The all-star, all-local cast includes Laurence Curry, Chris Kendall, Leslie O'Carroll, Luke Sorge, Brett Aune, Jessica Robblee and Amelia Corrada. John and Brian are presenting the play under the name Wild Blindness
Productions in partnership with the Bas Bleu Theatre Company of Fort Collins.
Making art isn't as easy as it sounds
<li>Making theatre is expensive. Making it from scratch is
insane. Making it from scratch and then taking it to the most expensive
city in America is downright daunting. Some of the major expenses
include venue rental, airfare, lodging, technical support and FAIRLY
COMPENSATING ARTISTS FOR THEIR WORK!
<li>Many crowdfunding
campaigns offer clever incentives. We've thought of a few, including the
opportunity to see the play in Denver before anyone in New York. But
let's face it: This is about helping to make art locally, and presenting
it nationally. Helping to make that happen is the greatest perk we have
to offer.
<li>All donations that require tax receipts should be mailed directly to
Bas Bleu Theatre Company, 401 Pine St., Fort Collins, CO 80524, with
WILD BLINDNESS written in the topic field.

Join us for our ""open rehearsals""

Whether you contribute or not, please feel welcome to join us at one of our workshoprehearsal runthroughs  at the Buntport Theater in Denver (7171 Lian St.) from July 28-Aug. 7, or
at Bas Bleu Theatre in Fort Collins (401 Pine
St.)on Monday. Aug. 1.
<li>July 28-30 (Thursday through Saturday), 7:30 p.m. start,
Buntport Theater
• July 31 (Sunday), 2 p.m. start, Buntport Theater
• Aug. 1 (Monday), 7:30 p.m. start, Bas Bleu Theatre,  Fort Collins
<li>Aug. 4-6 (Thursday through Saturday), 7:30 p.m. start,
Buntport Theater
• Aug. 7 (Sunday), 2 p.m. start, Buntport Theater
(Seating at all open-rehearsal
run-throughs is limited to 95, and is not
guaranteed.)
Performance schedule in New York City
• Friday, Aug. 12, 5 p.m.
• Saturday, Aug. 13, 2 p.m.
• Saturday, Aug. 13, 9:15 p.m.
• Sunday, Aug. 14, 8:30 p.m.
• Monday, Aug. 15, 6:45 p.m.
All performances at the 14th Street Y Theatre, 344 East 14th St (between 1st and 2nd Avenues), New York, NY 10003

","The Final Push More than 150 of you have helped us to raise nearly $20,000 to help bring the all-Colorado production of the play ""Waiting for Obama"" to the 20th annual New York International Fringe Festival in August 2016. Please help now as we push to raise the final $5,000 to make the project break even. Plot SummaryJohn Moore has championed Colorado

column1: theatre for 15 years as a dedicated arts journalist. He founded the
Denver Actors Fund and has raised more than $117,000 to help local
artists in need. Now he has written a topical, full-length play called that has been selected from among 1,200 entries to
be featured at NYC Fringe Festival.
But first, it will be previewed at the Buntport Theater in Denver and at
the Bas Bleu Theatre in Fort Collins so local audiences and donors can see it in process on
its way to New York. Let's help John put your money where his mouth has
been since 2001. Your donation will help:
Build an all-Colorado production that will be showcased with five performances in New York City.
Provide gainful employment for seven Colorado actors, a stage manager and director, as well as creative team raging from Scenic Designer to Light Designer to Stage Manager.
Showcase
the talents of Colorado artists at one of the most prestigious theatre
festivals in America. This is something we can all take ownership and
pride in.
So what is this play about?
In
""Waiting for Obama,"" one Colorado family is convinced the
President is coming for their guns. And in this town, they might be right.
While
propelled by one of the most divisive issues of our time, ""Waiting
for Obama"" is the story of a recognizable family that, like many
others, is deeply divided by polarizing
political beliefs.
The
director of ""Waiting for Obama"" is  Brian Freeland, who
carried the torch for avant garde theatre in Denver for 20 years with his

LIDA Project Theatre. The all-star, all-local cast includes Laurence Curry, Chris Kendall, Leslie O'Carroll, Luke Sorge, Brett Aune, Jessica Robblee and Amelia Corrada. John and Brian are presenting the play under the name Wild Blindness
Productions in partnership with the Bas Bleu Theatre Company of Fort Collins.

Hello, I am Laure Courtellemont!

Originally from France, I am an international choreographer currently residing in Los Angeles. I’ve dreamt of bringing my ideas and visions to life while inspiring others to do so by collaborating and spotlighting amazing dancers. I discovered dancehall 20 years ago in France. Since then I’ve taken on this mission to bring this amazing dance and culture to the forefront by teaching and travelling professionally all over the world. I’ve trained and studied the history of dancehall and its core with all my heart, love, and respect for over two decades. Today, I can say that I am the woman I am largely because of this expression!
- MY GOAL

One of my great dreams for this Jamaican originated art form is to give it an opportunity to be displayed on a live stage with some of the best dancers and actors of its kind. I want to showcase this passionate dance in all its glory in a way that any other well-respected dance should be shown. The Show will be held at Movement Lifestyle in North Hollywood, on June 18, 2016.
The Impact
<div>
1- PLATFORM OF EXPRESSION
I want to give dancehall a strong platform to show its power and potential to the world. Showcasing an amazing dance expression and spolightning great talents.
2- DIVERSITY

Born and raised in France, I am strong in my identity as a European dancer and choreographer having been emersed in a multi-cultural environment. I want to apply this by bringing together dancers from different countries onto one stage to find the delicate balance between the foundation of this dance and its artistic potential. I want to help create the path for dancehall to find its place from the street to the stage. The show will be filmed and also live streamed in multiple countries.
3- A SHOW FOR UNITY

This show will bring worldwide personalities of this dance form on one stage to remind all of us the power of unity! Different minds, energies, and flavors from all around the world connecting around the same love for dance. This organic African descent expression is a powerful dance rooted in meaning and passion. This show will bring attention to the dance industry and all lovers of dance a huge understanding and appreciation for this often misunderstood art form.
4- GIVING BACK
I want to give back to Jamaica and its incredibly rich culture by crediting a full-length showcase of Dancehall with some of the best of this genre.

A week before the show, on June 11th, the international dancers of the show will teach a one-day workshop and lecture about Dancehall and its Culture. All the proceeds from this workshop will be sent to children in need in Jamaica.
<div>
What We Need &
- WHAT WE NEED
<ul>

• My funding goal is $27,500 to cover all costs of the show including rental space for 2 weeks of rehearsals, full day rental of the venue to hold 2 showings, production (including lighting, equipment, crew, security, staff, designer, producer, assistant, make up artist, hair stylist), filming and editing, live-streaming, etc.

• Dancers from all over the world will come to North Hollywood for 2 weeks of intense training and rehearsals to create this platform to represent what we believe and live for. Their hard work and commitment will all be to prepare for this one night. Their passion will show the world the power of this art form, the power of making children's lives better, and the power of unity. These dancers will be coming at their own expense, however with your precious help, we can reach beyond this goal and assist them with their expenses.
<div>
- WHAT YOU GET
<ul>
• I am deeply THANKFUL to all my supporters and followers
column2: And to all the dreamers and those who help the others dream! I cannot say how grateful I would be if this project could come to life! It's about the Dance, the Culture and the Community! It's about opening new doors and dreaming bigger. It's about working passionately together on the same project, beyond nationality, background, or skin color.

column1: • The perks are thought out and created to let you the contributor be a part of this special project! From private classes, limited show merchandise, special backstage footage, an exclusive ""road to the show"" mini-series so you can follow the growth of this project, and more! You can find all the perks on the right side of the screen. Any contribution big or small is extremely appreciated. Without you, this project won't be possible!

Other Ways You Can Help


Please help spread the word about Dare To Dancehall Show!  You can do this by telling your family, friends, collegues about this project and sharing this Indiegogo fundraising campaign with them!  We appreciate every post, support in any kind, any gesture made on our behalf.
Check out and share the website!  http://www.laurecourtellemont.com/
LIKE on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/LaureCourtellemont/?fref=ts
FOLLOW us on Instagram!  http:/www.instagram.com/dare_to_dancehall_showla
Subscribe to the Youtube Channel!  http:/www.youtube.com/CourtellemontLaure

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR BEING A PART OF THIS PROJECT! It's going to be a great adventure! Dare To Dancehall will be a huge dream come true for not only me, but all the international dancers wanting to show the world how no matter where you're from, dance is what drives us

Short Summary
ABOUT (Introduce yourself and your background)

Ludens Ensemble is an Edinburgh-based theatre group which works with live music, masks, puppets, projections and animation, creating performances that ebb and flow between the aesthetics of critical distance and immersive experience.

Our first performance 'Macbeth: without words' was performed at the Hidden Door Festival in 2015 and in Cyprus as part of the ‘Pafos’ European Capital of Culture 2017 celebrations. We also performed at the Traverse Theatre as part of the Manipulate Festival 2016 to two 4 star reviews. Our second performance, Alfred Jarry's 'Ubu Roi' received funding from Creative Scotland and was premiered at the Hidden Door festival 2016 in Edinburgh to enthusiastic responses ( four in four sold out performances and two 4 star reviews). We are currently about to perform 'Macbeth' at the Fringe Festival 2016 in Edinburgh to be followed by a tour to the 'International Shakespeare Festival' in Shanghai.
THE PERFORMANCE

Ludens Ensemble presents ‘Macbeth: without words ’. A stark and stylised performance of this most familiar of tales, of boundless ambition and greed and the destruction it ultimately wreaks. Three actors perform all the characters on stage accompanied by video mapping projections and animation, a dynamic DJ set and a darkly brooding sound world, transforming Shakespeare’s words and narrative into a visual language of potent imagery and movement. This dramatic cluster of images incorporates Expressionism with Brecht and silent era film aesthetics, creating a powerful interpretation of Macbeth’s rapid rise to power and even more precipitous fall.

We are excited to be performing at this year's Edinburgh Fringe Festival at The Sanctuary, Zoo Venues. We have been listed in the Guardian as one of the top Shakespeare productions at this year's Edinburgh Fringe. The dates we are performing are 14th-29th August at 4pm.

column2: >After the Fringe, we will start touring internationally.
column3: >We have  been invited to perform at the '2016 Shanghai international Shakespeare Festival' with added potential of dates in Beijing but in order to make this tour happen, we need your help.

column2: >YOUR CONTRIBUTION- WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

column1:
Although we already have a firm offer to perform at the 'Shanghai  International Shakespeare festival', we do however need to raise money for our travel expenses (flights and visas) to get out to Shanghai. Our trip to Shanghai is a unique opportunity  for us to raise our international profile and also contribute towards consolidating the cultural links between Scotland and China. 


What We Need &

column2: >We are looking to raise £1000. This money will go towards covering the costs of flights for the company to perform in Shanghai. The Festival's offer to perform is confirmed and we are getting a fee for our performances there. Our accommodation and food expenses for when we arrive are all paid for. We, however, have to fund the flights to Shanghai ourselves. As a company, we need £5000 for flights and we are contributing some of this ourselves. We are also performing Macbeth: Without Words at Dumfries and Galloway prior to our festival run and the company have agreed to put their fee towards the flights to Shanghai. We do however still have a shortfall of £1000 to make up for flights. This is where this funding campaign comes in.
>We have made it easier for you to donate to our campaign should you wish to, with a number of perks available to you. You can give as much or as little as you like!
>WHAT WILL WE DO WITH THE MONEY IF WE DO NOT REACH OUR GOAL?
>If we do not reach our goal, we still have opportunities to perform in Berlin and in Cyprus. We will look to use the money to extend our tour in Europe and to raise our European profile.

column1: Is there a risk?

There are always risks. We have launched the campaign to raise money for the flight for the team to Shanghai. This is a significant cost to us. We do however also have support from European Capital of Culture Pafos 2017

How you can help

Although money is fantastic, it is not everything. We value the support of everyone engaging in this post. You can support us by tweeting, sharing our page on social media or coming to see one of our productions. You can visit our page at http://ludensensemble.co.uk/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/LudensEnsemble
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ludensensemble/

If you like the look of our production and our campaign it would be fantastic if you could  share it with your friends.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>Dear Contributor, we are the Directors of UDO
Australia and we have launched this campaign in an effort to assist the winners
of the 2015 National Street Dance Championships reach their goal of representing
Australia at the world’s largest street dance competition, UDO World Street
Dance Championship, in the UK at the end of August. <h3>
We are also the Director of Masters of Choreography
and we have brought this competition to Australia
with the belief that we have exceptional talent and creativity here that we
know can competitively represent Australia on a global arena.
We believe that this competition is much needed as
it provides dancers and their teams with an opportunity to compete to represent
Australia
and to showcase their talent, skills and creativity on a world stage.
Having lived in the UK for a decade, we know we have
the talent right here that can bring back the trophies and be called World
Street Dance Champions.
As every single cent raised will go to the dancers,
your involvement is extremely valuable in contributing to the dreams and
aspirations of every competitor. To win a trophy will be fantastic, to win
funds to help a dancer represent Australia at the world’s largest
street dance competition……..that’s what dreams are made of!
The more we raise for these dancers, the better! It’s not
easy to fly to the UK
when you are part of large team of dancers. That’s why every single cent raised

will go directly to the winners of the National finals in May. We need a lot of money to send every winner of this competition to the UK, however, this year we want to raise $15,000 so that we can help cover some of their costs. This is our first year of competition so as this competition grows each year and we gather more support from the street dance community, we hope to raise more and more until we are able to fly every winner to the UK without needing any further financial assistance. With everyone's help, the dancers will only need to focus on their dancing and becoming champions!
In gratitude for your contribution, we can offer you the
following:
Up to $30 – An e-Certificate of Appreciation
<strong>
Up to $50 – An e-Certificate of Appreciations and an entry ticket to the
competition on May 30 in Melbourne (MSAC).
<strong>
Up to $100 – An e-Certificate of Appreciation, 2 x entry
ticket to the competition on May 30 (MSAC) in Melbourne and a DVD of the
competition (Posted at a later date)
<strong>
Over $100 – all the above plus a T-shirt (Provided on
competition day or posted at a later date) and a further 2 tickets (Total of 4
tickets)
<strong>
Over $1000 – all of the above plus a further 16 tickets
(Total of 20 tickets)
We need your support. We need to show these dancers that we
believe in them, that we believe that they can wave the Aussie flag on behalf
of street dance.
This fundraiser has been created for all monies to be given to
the dancers. This fundraiser is to reward the solo dancers, the duos and the
dance teams for their endless hours of discipline, dedication and passion for
dance.
We brought this competition to Australia because we believe in the
culture of street dance and we believe in the talent that exists on our shores.
We wanted a competition that could be challenging, fun and purely for the
dancers.
Street dancers love to compete. They love to come together
under one roof to compete against others as well as to learn and observe the
moves from their colleagues in dance. It is a community that lives and breathes
for the street dance culture. For many, it is their only physical and creative
outlet and the competition is the perfect platform for them to combine this raw
energy, skill and talent. It is their time to shine!
The beauty of this particular campaign is that there is no
risk, at all! We are hosting this competition and we are proud to say that we
are expecting to have a fantastic event at the Melbourne Sports and Aquatic
Centre on Saturday, May 30.
Every cent raised is going to the winners, it is up to you to
decide how much they will receive. If we raise sufficient that nobody has to
dip into their own pockets to travel to the UK, absolutely brilliant. If we do
not, then what we have raised will undoubtedly still be a great boost to the
dancers efforts to reach the UK
to dance for Australia.
It is a win-win!
We are hoping that we can all demonstrate the support that
the street dance community holds from family, friends and the corporate
industry. By this form of expression we hope to show potential sponsors and
government departments that this competition and its participants are worthy of
their financial support.
Whether you can contribute financially or whether your
contribution is in the form of promoting our event on your social mediums such
as Facebook or using the Indiegogo share tools, it will all be extremely
appreciated and we will always be grateful.
Spread the word, contribute to this amazing fundraiser, buy a
ticket to the competition, your support is much needed!
Let’s get these dancers to the UK!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

with the belief that we have exceptional talent and creativity here that we
know can competitively represent Australia on a global arena.
We believe that this competition is much needed as
it provides dancers and their teams with an opportunity to compete to represent
Australia
and to showcase their talent, skills and creativity on a world stage.
Having lived in the UK for a decade, we know we have
the talent right here that can bring back the trophies and be called World
Street Dance Champions.
As every single cent raised will go to the dancers,
your involvement is extremely valuable in contributing to the dreams and
aspirations of every competitor. To win a trophy will be fantastic, to win
funds to help a dancer represent Australia at the world’s largest
street dance competition……..that’s what dreams are made of!
The more we raise for these dancers, the better! It’s not
easy to fly to the UK
when you are part of large team of dancers. That’s why every single cent raised

will go directly to the winners of the National finals in May. We need a lot of money to send every winner of this competition to the UK, however, this year we want to raise $15,000 so that we can help cover some of their costs. This is our first year of competition so as this competition grows each year and we gather more support from the street dance community, we hope to raise more and more until we are able to fly every winner to the UK without needing any further financial assistance. With everyone's help, the dancers will only need to focus on their dancing and becoming champions!
In gratitude for your contribution, we can offer you the
following:
Up to $30 – An e-Certificate of Appreciation
Up to $50 – An e-Certificate of Appreciations and an entry ticket to the
competition on May 30 in Melbourne (MSAC).
Up to $100 – An e-Certificate of Appreciation, 2 x entry
ticket to the competition on May 30 (MSAC) in Melbourne and a DVD of the
competition (Posted at a later date)
Over $100 – all the above plus a T-shirt (Provided on
competition day or posted at a later date) and a further 2 tickets (Total of 4
tickets)
Over $1000 – all of the above plus a further 16 tickets
(Total of 20 tickets)
We need your support. We need to show these dancers that we
believe in them, that we believe that they can wave the Aussie flag on behalf
of street dance.
This fundraiser has been created for all monies to be given to
the dancers. This fundraiser is to reward the solo dancers, the duos and the
dance teams for their endless hours of discipline, dedication and passion for
dance.
We brought this competition to Australia because we believe in the
culture of street dance and we believe in the talent that exists on our shores.
We wanted a competition that could be challenging, fun and purely for the
dancers.
Street dancers love to compete. They love to come together
under one roof to compete against others as well as to learn and observe the
moves from their colleagues in dance. It is a community that lives and breathes
for the street dance culture. For many, it is their only physical and creative
outlet and the competition is the perfect platform for them to combine this raw
energy, skill and talent. It is their time to shine!
The beauty of this particular campaign is that there is no
risk, at all! We are hosting this competition and we are proud to say that we
are expecting to have a fantastic event at the Melbourne Sports and Aquatic
Centre on Saturday, May 30.
Every cent raised is going to the winners, it is up to you to
decide how much they will receive. If we raise sufficient that nobody has to
dip into their own pockets to travel to the UK, absolutely brilliant. If we do
not, then what we have raised will undoubtedly still be a great boost to the
dancers efforts to reach the UK
to dance for Australia.
It is a win-win!
We are hoping that we can all demonstrate the support that
the street dance community holds from family, friends and the corporate
industry. By this form of expression we hope to show potential sponsors and
government departments that this competition and its participants are worthy of
their financial support.
Whether you can contribute financially or whether your
contribution is in the form of promoting our event on your social mediums such
as Facebook or using the Indiegogo share tools, it will all be extremely
appreciated and we will always be grateful.
Spread the word, contribute to this amazing fundraiser, buy a
ticket to the competition, your support is much needed!
Let’s get these dancers to the UK!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Melbourne, Australia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/udo-australia-national-street-dance-championship/pica

Hello,  my name is David Fernandez and I am a New York City based
column5:
>choreographer.

My goal is to raise money so I can  finally blend my two passions together: Dance and Video Art. Dance is something that I have been working on for awhile. Video is something I would love to explore more.
column7:
>With the funds I hope to raise, I will purchase a projector. By having a projector of my own, I will be able to test, experiment and edit the videos that will be projected during my work.My video art  will enhance my choreography.

I succeeded in my past two KickStarter campaigns, and now, with the help of the IndieGoGo community, I am confident I can reach my goal again. 

If you are not able to contribute,  it would be still be helpful if you could spread the word of my fundraising efforts.

Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

You'll get insight, laugh at yourself, and maybe even grow.

The Opportunity!
<ul>
<li>

What could happen as a result of performing in New York? Anything! It will be a chance to get seen by a whole new crowd of people--potential investors, entertainment industry, and best of all, great NY audiences.
<li>

Laura Lundy-Paine, of Blue Panther, is the producer at large, she has found the theatre, and we're on our way!

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

My biggest dream is to be do comedy on big stages around the world and have people leave the show different from when they came in. While my track record shows some great successes, each have been hard-earned through many tears (of a clown, of course). Pretty much the only risk I'm taking is an emotional one. To share this much vulnerable material in front of an audience. And the amazing support network of friends and family, as well as the addition of this awesome producer Laura, makes this SO doable. I'm excited to take the leap!

column1:

Oy vey, this is really happening... break out the gefilte fish!

Alicia

","Is it Time (Funny) Straight-Talk from Women Goes Mainstream?
Finally, with female comedians like Amy Schumer, we're starting to hear women talk about sex and relationships from the female perspective. What a concept! Let's continue this trend!

The Oy of Sex is an outrageous comedy show that looks at our relationship to... relationships. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, you’ll think, “Oh my God, she's a little bit like me!” It's a funny, intimate evening that breaks down boundaries and gets you thinking about what's really important. You'll get insight, laugh at yourself, and maybe even grow.
Help us launch this comedy show Off-(Off-) Broadway by pre-ordering tickets now. We're offering sweet deals and great perks.
About Alicia & The Oy of Sex
As a comedian, I've been traveling the world doing underground comedy & solo performance for half my life. I was recently voted Best Comedian in both the SF Weekly and SF Bay Guardian.

After many years of self-producing my work, and years dreaming of meeting someone who would come help out, I finally met a producer: Laura! After my show in Hollywood this June she said, ""I love your show. I want to help you take it to New York!""

This is my third one-woman show. The Oy of Sex was recently given a 4-month 3-night a week run at the prestigious Marsh Theatre in San Francisco. My shows have won numerous awards, including Best of Solo Performer (SF Fringe), Best Storyteller (NY United Solo Fest), and Pick of the Fringe (Hollywood Fringe).
What We Need & What You Get

We need a minimum of $10,000 to produce the show for a 3 week run, 5 nights a week, March 28-April 15, 2016. The money will go to rent the venue we found, Shelter Studios at 54th & Broadway, to pay the stage professionals (lighting, sound, etc.), hire a director for fine-tuning, pay a PR person/firm, and print and distribute marketing, etc.
Perks for you include exclusive sponsorship, 1-1 comedy punch-up sessions with me, tickets to the show in NY, comedy classes, and downloads of the show online.
If I don't reach my entire goal, all the funds you give will still go to the production. This run is happening one way or another!
The Opportunity!

What could happen as a result of performing in New York? Anything! It will be a chance to get seen by a whole new crowd of people--potential investors, entertainment industry, and best of all, great NY audiences.

Laura Lundy-Paine, of Blue Panther, is the producer at large, she has found the theatre, and we're on our way!    Risks & Challenges  My biggest dream is to be do comedy on big stages around the world and have people leave the show different from when they came in. While my track record shows some great successes, each have been hard-earned through many tears (of a clown, of course). Pretty much the only risk I'm taking is an emotional one. To share this much vulnerable material in front of an audience. And the amazing support network of friends and family, as well as the addition of this awesome producer Laura, makes this SO doable. I'm excited to take the leap!

Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute a lot, you can still contribute a little... And if you can't contribute a little, it doesn't mean you can't help:  Would you get the word out and make some noise about this campaign? You can use the Indiegogo share tools..   Oy vey, this is really happening... break out the gefilte fish!Alicia",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<li><b>COME SEE THE SHOW!<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

About People Helping People, Inc.

People Helping People, Inc., the organization, helps citizens to be independent and self-sufficient.  We also believe in supporting those in the arts by providing opportunities for artists to both develop and showcase their talent.  By way of the theatrical outreach of MURPHY'S LAW: Group Therapy Gone Wild, PHP's goal is to show all that sharing what we internalize is a healthy step in the right direction of obtaining well-being.  Our mission is to encourage those who've experienced mental health issues and/or trauma to speak up and reach out.  Further, PHP seeks to reduce suicides by providing dramatic evidence that there is a path to healing and hope.  For more on PHP, please visit our website.

Our Arts &
column2:
Entertainment branch is comprised of passionate individuals including:

Andrea Clinton (Playwright, Director, Producer), a graduate of Montclair State University--MFA, Theatre Studies, with degree's in Journalism, English and Film.  Known for her works as ""Author"", Andrea has been writing  plays, short stories, and films for over 30 years.  Andrea wrote MURPHY'S LAW: Group Therapy Gone Wild to bring to the forefront the issues everyday people face and often internalize, which lead to an imbalance of mental health and often, suicide. 

Monique Maye (Producer), holds degrees in Political Science, Sports Management (MS), and Law.  She is a licensed agent and law professor at Columbia University in Chicago, IL.  Monique is an advocate for Mental Health Awareness and Suicide Prevention, the arts, theatre, and vessels for healing.

Doriane Swain (Producer, Actor) graduated from Rutgers Univ. with a BA in Theatre Arts, with a semester abroad at the London Academy of Theatre.  Doriane has performed and produced works throughout the tri-state area.  A seasoned, imaginative actor, she brings out the creative best in those she performs with.  She's a known player in NJ theatre, and is no stranger to New York's theatre scene.
column7: Entertainment gives thanks to our sponsors who have donated monetarily or by offering in-kind services, waiving or significantly decreasing fees.

column1: ","SYNOPSIS

In Murphy’s Law, Dr. Pew, an unconventional, quirky and hippie-psychotherapist, brings her patients together for Dramatic Group Therapy, but anything that can go wrong, does go wrong and her patients fly off the chain gang one by one, causing much laughter and drama.

To be performed next, with your help, at Union County Performing Arts Center on Hamilton Stage in Rahway, NJ. This production is in part, sponsored by Union County Advancing Community Theatre Initiative.  See show dates below!
Who We Are & What We Do

People Helping People, Arts & Entertainment was established in 2014 as a arts and entertainment subsidiary of People Helping People, Inc. (a non-profit organization founded in 1998) with the mission of offering perspectives, anecdotes and rememdies to real life issues and to tell compelling stories that leave audiences entertained.
We Need Your Help!

As a new non-profit theatre group presenting our first production, we have many needs and few resources.  Our aim is to keep tickets reasonably priced in an effort to contribute to audience attendance and thereby greater outreach. We need your help in making a tax-deductible contribution to theatre and our mission of Mental Health Awareness and Suicide Prevention via the arts.  All donations will offset production costs and fees.
Donations of every level are deeply appreciated with a token of our gratitude.  Please see the Perks Section for details.
If a monetary contribution is not the right fit for you, donations of supplies, services, rehearsal space and time are needed as well.  Contact us at php.art.ent@gmail.com for alternate ways to give.
The Impact

Through the medium of theatre, PHP Arts & Entertainment contributes to our cultural and emotional enrichment by bringing to audiences pertinent subject matter in a way that evokes laughter, tears and open communication.
MURPHY'S LAW: Group Therapy Gone Wild
Destigmatizes the topic of mental health by revealing the common human thread of pain, suffering and healing
Offers hope to those who have considered or are considering suicide
Provides awareness and a connection with others which is a path to healing
Allows each audience member connect to its characters and themes
Provokes communication about mental health, which is part of a healing process in some cases and an educational process for all
Production History
Workshop, Newark, NJ.  Two successful performances
MURPHY'S LAW: Group Therapy Gone Wild, the documentary.  Shot in Newark, NJ
Currently, we are preparing to commence rehearsals for our 4-show run at UCPAC's Hamilton Stage in the heart of Rahway's Arts District.
Other Ways You Can Help

An amazing team of artists, creators, producers, movers and shakers have come together for one purpose:  to advocate Mental Health Awareness & Suicide Prevention.  The most important element of this production is the audience.  More so than anything, we want as many people as possible to see the show!
Share this campaign among your social network!
Like us on Facebook!
COME SEE THE SHOW!

We all like to eavesdrop on other
people’s conversations, but we never get the full story. I want to offer
audience members a bigger glimpse into strangers’ worlds. Instead of watching
these things play out on a stage, the audience gets to be a part of each scene.
Being able to hear what’s going on through headphones, they are part of the
in-crowd, where others can only wonder what is taking place.
I’m very excited to have gotten the
chance to perform during the Fort Collins Fringe Festival and bring a unique
form of theatre to Fort Collins. It’s been one of my favorite experiences as an
audience member. And now, after being on stage for over 10 years, I’m looking
forward to working on this production as a writer, director and producer as Dutch Boy Productions.
At the start, audience members will get
a set of wireless headphones and a map of downtown Fort Collins, with a few
locations highlighted. Once they get into range of a scene, they’ll be able to
hear the audio. Then they only need to find it.
The element that is key to this
production is audio. I have been very fortunate to get a sponsorship from
Silent Events, as well as help with sound design from OpenStage Theatre, plus
support from Grant Putney. And although I can gladly say that my project is
powered by Silent Events, there is still an amount of $500 that I’m paying for
myself. That, plus some other expenses (batteries, power cables, print
materials etc.), is why I’m reaching out to you.
In return, you will not only have my
gratitude, but I’ll also be able to grant a few perks:
<li>
Donations of $25 and up get a shout out
on the Dutch Boy Productions Facebook page
<li>Donations of $50 and up guarantee a
‘seat’ in one of the three performances
<li>Donations of $100 and up get to name a
character
Please help to support this project,
one unlike Fort Collins has ever seen. Spread the word. And of course: come see
it. These are the performance times of ‘Downtown Drama’:
<li>
Friday 8/28 at 8:00 PM
<li>
Saturday 8/29 at 1:00 PM
• Saturday 8/29 at 6:30 PM
All tours start at the Community
Creative Center (200 Mathews St, Fort Collins).

<div>
<div>
The Story
NASA Space program sends two astronauts on a widely publicized lunar mission. Fred, the
mission commander is already an astronaut of national renown, with a number of successful missions under his belt. He is joined by Ditch, a
bright, young, media savvy upstart on his first space mission. Comic relief is provided by Les,
the homophobic mission control chief. During the tense moments before mission
launch, Ditch suddenly declares his love for Fred. Is this true love or just a moment of
catharsis and hero worship?
<div>
<div>
<div>
<div>

column2: >Sexual tension overwhelms this confined space capsule, but is everything as it really seems?

column1: When the astronaut’s workplace kiss is revealed live on national TV during a broadcast, their

relationship begins to deteriorate. The pragmatic Ditch will do whatever it takes to further his career ambitions, while Fred is finally willing and ready to live his truth. Can the two rocket men put aside their personal emotions  to see this high stakes mission through to success or will their ill timed lip lock lead to disaster.....only time will tell. 

Show Location: 
VENUE #2: Flamboyan Theatre at the Clemente
107 Suffolk Street
(between Rivington &
column2:
Delancey)

column1: Why this play? Why now?

column2: >This play asks its audience whether America is ready for gay people as heroic figures. Our

column1: company believes this question is even more relevant today than when this play was first

written in the late 80’s and early 90’s. More recently we are seeing an increased visibility for publicly gay figures such as new reporter Anderson Cooper, Apple's CEO Tim Cook and the first openly gay U.S. Senator Tammy Baldwin.  The questions raised by this play will leave
the audience thinking and struggling with important questions about masculinity, hero

worship, gender, and the struggle of living openly gay in America. With the repeal of the U.S. Military’s “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell” policy and the recent Supreme Court decision on same sex marriage this is a topic on the minds of many Americans.
The Production

column2: >The Blue Comet Company has been looking to bring a “space play” to the stage. We

column1: understand the unique challenges of setting a stage play in space, but are looking forward to
facing this challenge head on under the visionary and creative direction of Michael Damico.
Our discovery of this previously un-produced play presents The Blue Comet Company and the
New York International Fringe Festival with an opportunity to host a World Premiere production
written by award winning playwright, Robert Shaffron (Bums, Samuel French, 2004)

The Team
Robert Shaffron is an award winning playwright whose plays have appears Off-Broadway,
Off-Off Broadway, and in Regional Theater throughout the world. His work has been
published by Smith &amp
column2: Krause and Samuel French. He has written for Nickelodeon and has

column1: created TV and Radio commercials for some of America’s top brands. He is a regular
contributor Village Q, a website for LGBT families. His most recent writing will appear in the
new anthology Listen to Your Mother, available at amazon.com.
Michael Damico has a BA and MA from California Institute of the Arts. At Cal Arts he
directed several short films. He has worked on both Hollywood and Bollywood productions in
many roles. A lifelong theatergoer from Chicago, Damico’s work merges an advanced
technical expertise with an indexical knowledge of film history in a way that speaks to
audiences looking for something new and fresh from the theatrical experience. Damico’s
directing style evokes natural and thoughtful performances, and The Blue Comet Company is
thrilled to be collaborating with this emerging directorial talent. The Blue Comet Company
shares his vision of a theater experience that is conscious of the needs and expectations of a
new generation of theatergoers.
James David Adelman studied acting at The William Esper Studio, New York and The
Second City, Chicago. He is a writer, attorney, and the current Artistic Director of The Blue
Comet Company. Adelman most recently produced and starred in The Blue Comet
Company’s 2014 Off Off Broadway production of James McClure’s 1959. Pink Thunderbird
Convertible. Prior to attending William Esper Studio, Adelman performed in several Off Off
Broadway productions. Adelman was also a member of Off Off Campus, University of
Chicago’s popular student run improv and sketch comedy troupe. James started performing

in Regional Theater as a child in New Jersey and honed his craft as a student actor and Vice President of The Lawrenceville School's Periwig Club and as a member of University of Chicago's University Theater. He also spent a year abroad at University of Bologna's prestigious DAMS program studying dramaturgy and Italian Cinema.
<div>
<div style=""text-align: justify
Patrick S. Judd has a B.A. in Theater Studies and Performance from the Richard Stockton
University of New Jersey. At Stockton he acted, directed, and produced many shows.
Patrick was also President of the University's Theater Club. Several of his college productions
toured in Turkey and Greece. Other career highlights include co-authoring and starring in a
one man show based on the life of Lord Byron and starring in a number of independent
feature length and short films. Patrick co-founded The Blue Comet Company and is currently
Chief Executive Officer. In 2014, he starred in The Blue Comet Company’s Off-Off Broadway
Production of 1959 Pink Thunderbird Convertible.

Deon Frank has  a B.A in Television and Radio Brooklyn College in 2013. Deciding to pursue a career as a Professional Actor, He joined the Barrow Group Theatre Company’s 1.5 year Conservatory while working in bars to support himself. Deon says joining the Barrow Group was one of the best decisions he’s ever made, as it “Completely changed the way he thought of Acting”. Deon recently made NYC headlines when he took down a mugger who dragged a tourist down a city block while trying to steal her bag, making a national appearance on Fox &
column2: Friends. Deon is also preparing to audition for the Actors Studio where he’s already managed to make it to the second round.

column1: Piper Rae Patterson has a BFA in musical theatre from the University of Central Florida. Regional credits include Venus in Fur, Collected Stories, Dancing at Lughnasa, It's a Wonderful Life, and Sense and Sensibility. She has also appeared in numerous film projects including Interior, 3 by 3, 1 by 1 (named Coup de Coeur at the 65th Cannes Film Festival) and HeartBreak.
<div>

What are the funds used for?

The funds raised from this campaign will be used to cover the various costs that are accrued during the show producing process. This includes paying the various designers (lights, set, sound, props and costume) for their time and talents and the necessary materials they will need. Next is our truly talented actors, and the rehearsal spaces needed to help bring these convincing characters to life. Then we need to cover the cost of the venue and the necessary insurance needed. We also need to cover costs for marketing and advertising so people actually know the show is going on. Beyond that are the smaller needs such as printing and transportation that all add up by the end of the creative process. We have completed a careful cost analysis to ensure we get the most bang for our buck and do this script justice
column2:
and most importantly create an entertaining piece of theater for the public. 

What's in it for me?

column1: <div>
","The Story
The
NASA Space program sends two astronauts on a widely publicized lunar mission. Fred, the
mission commander is already an astronaut of national renown, with a number of successful missions under his belt. He is joined by Ditch, a
bright, young, media savvy upstart on his first space mission. Comic relief is provided by Les,
the homophobic mission control chief. During the tense moments before mission
launch, Ditch suddenly declares his love for Fred. Is this true love or just a moment of
catharsis and hero worship?
Sexual tension overwhelms this confined space capsule, but is everything as it really seems?
When the astronaut’s workplace kiss is revealed live on national TV during a broadcast, their

relationship begins to deteriorate. The pragmatic Ditch will do whatever it takes to further his career ambitions, while Fred is finally willing and ready to live his truth. Can the two rocket men put aside their personal emotions  to see this high stakes mission through to success or will their ill timed lip lock lead to disaster.....only time will tell. Show Location: VENUE #2: Flamboyan Theatre at the Clemente107 Suffolk Street(between Rivington & Delancey)TICKETS ARE NOW AVAILABLE - CLICK ON A DATE BELOW FOR MORE INFO: WEDNESDAY - AUGUST 19TH 4:45 PMFRIDAY - AUGUST 21ST 2:15 PMMONDAY - AUGUST 24TH 9:15 PMWEDNESDAY - AUGUST 26TH 7:00 PMFRIDAY - AUGUST 28TH 9:30 PM
Why this play? Why now?
This play asks its audience whether America is ready for gay people as heroic figures. Our
company believes this question is even more relevant today than when this play was first

written in the late 80’s and early 90’s. More recently we are seeing an increased visibility for publicly gay figures such as new reporter Anderson Cooper, Apple's CEO Tim Cook and the first openly gay U.S. Senator Tammy Baldwin.  The questions raised by this play will leave
the audience thinking and struggling with important questions about masculinity, hero

worship, gender, and the struggle of living openly gay in America. With the repeal of the U.S. Military’s “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell” policy and the recent Supreme Court decision on same sex marriage this is a topic on the minds of many Americans.
The Production
The Blue Comet Company has been looking to bring a “space play” to the stage. We
understand the unique challenges of setting a stage play in space, but are looking forward to
facing this challenge head on under the visionary and creative direction of Michael Damico.
Our discovery of this previously un-produced play presents The Blue Comet Company and the
New York International Fringe Festival with an opportunity to host a World Premiere production
written by award winning playwright, Robert Shaffron (Bums, Samuel French, 2004)
